About Us:At [Company Name], we leverage data-driven insights to enhance our marketing strategies and drive growth. We are currently looking for a skilled Data Marketing Analyst who can analyze sales performance and demographic data within key regions. This role will be crucial in shaping our marketing initiatives and identifying opportunities for expansion.
Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret sales data to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Conduct demographic and geographic analysis of target regions.
Generate comprehensive reports on sales performance by area and customer demographics.
Provide actionable insights to inform marketing strategies and business decisions.
Collaborate with marketing, sales, and product teams to align data findings with company goals.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and assess the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.
Create visual reports, dashboards, and presentations for stakeholders.
Stay up to date with market trends, customer behavior, and regional demographics.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business, or a related field.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within sales or marketing.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Google Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate complex data insights in a clear and actionable manner.
Detail-oriented with a strong sense of accountability.
Familiarity with demographic analysis and geographic mapping tools is a plus.

Why Join Us?

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits.
Opportunity to impact the company’s growth through data-driven insights.

  Ameresco, Inc. (NYSE:AMRC) is a leading cleantech integrator and renewable energy asset developer, owner and operator. Our comprehensive portfolio includes energy efficiency, infrastructure upgrades, asset sustainability and renewable energy solutions delivered to clients throughout North America and Europe. Our solutions range from upgrades to facility’s energy infrastructure to the development, construction and operation of renewable energy plants combined with tailored financial solutions. We foster an entrepreneurial, collaborative, and forward-thinking culture that thrives with innovation, diversity of thought, and inclusion. We are excited with all that the future holds for our industry, planet, and communities.
 


  Ameresco has a current opening for an Analyst – AEG consulting group.
 


  Applied Energy Group (AEG), a division of Ameresco, is seeking a dedicated Analyst to join its Consulting division. The successful candidate will evaluate energy usage, assess the effectiveness of energy efficiency and demand response programs, contribute to distributed energy resource planning, and perform cost-effectiveness analysis. This role requires a strong quantitative skillset that integrates data science, statistics, and econometrics, along with the ability to excel in a dynamic and collaborative consulting environment.
 


  Responsibilities:


Perform wide range of complex, energy-related analysis which may include: statistical analyses, analysis of energy consumption data, estimation of utility program energy savings, measure engineering analysis, benefit-cost analysis, program development and planning, evaluation analysis, market research, survey design, and secondary research.
Manage ETL processes to integrate and transform data for analysis
Manage assigned tasks and analyses to project manager and manager’s satisfaction.
Prepare written reports and presentation materials and assist in the development of project deliverables.
Communicate analytical methods and results to clients.
Justify and document technical decisions related to research, planning, and data analysis.
Build and maintain relationships with clients to maximize productivity and cultivate future opportunities.
Develop and execute analysis plans for tasks and/or projects.
Begin to develop expertise in a chosen practice area by staying at the forefront of the industry in terms of methods, and or innovations.



  Minimum Qualifications:
 

BA/BS in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
Minimum of 1 year experience working in energy efficiency technology assessment, utility program development and implementation, program evaluation, clean energy analysis, or related areas.



  Additional Qualifications:
 

MA/MS in a related field
Certifications in basic programming or data analytics
Demonstrated strong analytical, problem-solving and decision making expertise
Skilled in data management, ETL processes, and visualization
Experience with one or more of the following programming languages: R, Stata, SQL, Python
Experience with Microsoft Excel, Power Query, and PowerBI
Familiarity with geospatial analyses and advanced statistical approaches
Familiarity of energy codes and standards related to energy efficiency measures
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to handle complexity and articulate findings clearly.
Ability to develop analysis plans for discrete tasks and/or projects
Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Sound business ethics, including the protection of proprietary and confidential information
Superior interpersonal skills including courtesy, professionalism and a cooperative attitude
Strong organizational skills with proven ability to follow through on multiple tasks and priorities.



  #LI-SMC
 


  AMERESCO challenges the brightest, most talented and creative individuals in the industry by providing an environment that embraces initiative, diversity, and achievement along with comprehensive rewards, including people-oriented insurance, investment, and incentive plans.
 

 Genuine Ameresco communications use @ameresco.com emails; any other domain is fraudulent. Report suspected phishing to 1-866-AMERESCO.

Bring your support to a governmental agency that develops and protects water resources for the people of Ohio.

Salary: The salary range is $73,500 - $85,000 annually which is supplemented by a comprehensive Benefits Package which includes: medical, dental, vision, basic life insurance, short term and long term disability, participation in the Ohio Public Employees Retirement System, and paid time off.
About The Authority: The State of Ohio created the OWDA to provide funding for construction of public water and wastewater infrastructure in Ohio. Since its creation in 1968, the Authority has funded the planning, design, and construction of over $19.4 billion of water and wastewater projects. OWDA pursues borrowing that assures the OWDA the lowest cost of funds in order to maintain low borrowing rates for the local governments of Ohio. These low borrowing rates allow local governments to construct necessary water and sewer improvements while minimizing the impact to user charges.
About The Position:The Loan Analyst works with local government agencies to plan, structure, and award loans and grants for water and wastewater and other environmental infrastructure projects. The Loan Analyst analyzes the financial borrowing capacity of local government agencies and provides risk analysis to the Loan Officer. This position monitors the financial strength of borrowers through ongoing analysis of the financial health of communities with outstanding OWDA debt. Assists local governmental agencies with the loan application process, structuring of loans, identifies the proper loan programs, reviews all loan applications, provides technical and other assistance when needed. Coordinates with other state agencies on awarded loans for co-managed loan programs. Processes and encumbers loans in the Loan Processing program and makes them available to the other OWDA staff to enable disbursement of funds. The Loan Analyst will maintain knowledge on the status of projects from concept through construction and will ensure all planning loans are paid in full prior to construction. This position is FSLA exempt position that will work a full-time, forty hour, Monday through Friday weekly schedule. This is a hybrid work environment with remote work and two in office days each week.
The Ideal Candidate: The ideal candidate will work in an environment that values employees, customers, partners, and our state’s water resources. This person will work in a typical work environment and will have the ability to work independently and as a team in a hybrid remote work environment and possess the flexibility the work environment may bring. They will have strong organizational and planning skills, and will have the ability to manage time, expectations, and utilize self-motivation that maintains momentum and progress. They will have knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and be able to identify, evaluate, and generate information in a digital format. The Loan Analyst will represent the Authority to state and local governments and to professional associations providing prompt customer service in a courteous and helpful manner. This person will participate in a work environment that offers supportive teamwork and collaboration.
Typical Duties: The Loan Analyst is expected to perform the full scope of duties with minimum supervision. Successful performance requires knowledge of governmental finance and accounting procedures and the ability to communicate verbally and digitally on complex matters. This position will successfully manage multiple priorities and tasks.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution with a preferred degree in accounting or finance, or have equivalent experience.
Experience in public finance or accounting, or with financial analysis with water and sewer systems and/or public utilities is a plus.
Requirements: Requires the ability to remain stationary, move about, transfer and control items or equipment, and to reach. Must be able to communicate and exchange information, comprehend and interpret text, spreadsheets, and graphical documents. Must possess emotional intelligence to be self-aware, empathetic, resilient, and adaptable.
NOTE: OWDA is committed to providing access and inclusion and reasonable accommodation in its services, activities, programs and employment opportunities in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and other applicable laws. The information contained in this job announcement is not a complete list the functions of the job. The person selected for employment will be required to pass a background check and pre-employment drug screen. Employment is contingent on successful completion of this process.

 JOB OVERVIEW - Research, develop and apply techniques to collect, analyze, and report quantitative and non-quantitative health care information that assists health executives, providers, and administrators’ managers, accounting, or other professionals make data-driven, strategic decisions, reduce health care costs, deliver better care, and overall have a positive impact on people’s lives.

Responsible for modifying and updating data collection or statistical models based on changing or differing industry standards, needs of requesters, projects, or programs.
Coordinate, collaborate, and communicate within an agency or business unit on research projects.
Coordinate research and statistics with other operations and functions of the agency or business unit. Analyze and integrate various data sources and factors to produce projections or trends.
Prepare research reports containing descriptive, analytical, and evaluative content, including recommendations.
Works as part of the RAP Bureau with a primary focus on healthcare data and projects.
Assist and support other data analysis needs of the department.

Types of data sources to be analyzed:

Clinical data: The most common type of health care data analytics is clinical data. This includes using electronic health records (EHRs) to directly improve medical outcomes.
Claims data: Health Services Data Analysts will analyze claims data to help institutions identify trends in treatment which could provide critical financial readiness and planning.
Pharmaceutical data: Data could include pharmaceutical trends, expenses, and healthcare decision making.
Behavioral data: Data specific to mental health and mental disorders, pharmaceutical interventions, behavioral interventions, suicide, and substance use.
Public health data: A health services data analyst might work with public health data to deliver statistics, infographics, and reports after identifying methods for preventing disease or promoting health within a population.


This position is a hybrid position located in Helena, MT with at least two days in the office.

 Tobacco Free - Use of all tobacco products, including smokeless tobacco products and tobacco substitutes in Department of Corrections buildings, is prohibited. In secure care facilities possession of tobacco products is also prohibited.

The required knowledge, skills, and abilities are typically acquired through a combination of education and experience equivalent to a minimum of a bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, epidemiology, or another related research-intensive field.

Experience with Tableau is preferred.

Written and verbal communication, creative thinking, interpersonal skills, and time management.
Experience with EHR, medical terminology, and medical billing are extremely useful—and can help you land a job more easily.
Eligible to work in the United States

 Overview ...: 
 
  The Senior Data Analyst position is a highly skilled and motivated individual who will reside within the Automated Systems division finance department, reporting directly to the Strategy Manager. This role will interact with multiple facilities within the United States and Europe. The individual will need to have operational understanding of processes supported by business intelligence solutions, including manufacturing, warehousing, sales, service, and finance.
 

  The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data visualization software, programming data collection tools, and will be highly skilled in communicating. This role involves managing projects from concept, implementation, and validation of data by working closely with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making to enhance our business intelligence capabilities.
 

  This position requires working knowledge of implementing application programming interfaces (APIs) and languages C#, Java, or Python. The candidate will also have strong knowledge of programing in Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio. The goal of the programming tools is to automate the data collection process from data source platforms, such as ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and Jira. The ideal candidate will have in-depth experience with using and programming data visualization platforms such as Microsoft Power BI (Power Business Intelligence) and Tableau. Having experience with the Smartsheet platform and integrating data sources (via API, Event Reporting, and Bridge) is a definite plus.
  The Opportunity ...: 
 
Develop and maintain APIs to facilitate data integration and automation processes utilizing programming languages such as C#, Java, or Python
Design and implement data models and databases to support business needs
Create and manage reporting solutions using Microsoft Power Business Intelligence (Power BI) and Tableau
Develop and maintain SQL solutions in Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio
Develop and maintain Smartsheet platform data integration solutions (via API, Event Reporting, and Bridge) are a plus
Working knowledge of Salesforce is a plus
Collaborate with various departments to gather and understand data requirements
Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions
Provide technical expertise and support for ERP systems and their integration with other data sources via API and SQL
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security across all reporting and analytical processes
Continuously improve data collection and analysis processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Use excellent processes such as validation, documentation, and change management
Provide as required troubleshooting support
Train business stakeholders on the solutions and new functionalities
Project management skill set to document requirements, prioritize them with the business stakeholders, utilize and maintain scheduling, budget management, and use of Microsoft PowerPoint for reporting purposes to the business stakeholders
Performs other duties as assigned

 Data Analyst Flex General Management Consultant
  The Opportunity: As a Data Analyst, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. With the abundance of structured and unstructured data, you understand the importance of transforming complex data sets into useful information to solve challenges. As a Data Analyst at Booz Allen, you can use your skills and experience to support a mission and use data for good. We need a Data Analyst like you to bring your knowledge to modernize the defense industry.

As a client-facing Flex Data Analyst, you’ll work closely with your team and clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Not only will you provide a deep understanding of their data, you’ll also advise your client on what the information means and how it can be used to make an impact on the availability and safety of critical defense assets. You’ll prepare and conduct business analyses and study needs assessments, requirements analysis or definition, and cost or benefit analyses to align business systems, solutions, and initiatives. You’ll analyze metrics, performance measurements, requirements, reports, and recommendations for the management, organizational structure, policies and procedures, and business systems.

 How You’ll Contribute: As a data analyst on our team, you’ll:

Use your data analytics expertise to support client and stakeholder relationships.
Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through collection, interpretation, and evaluation of large data sets.
Contribute to impactful work and guide decision-making across multiple organizations.
Apply consulting skills and data analytics expertise by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.
Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages, including SQL, R, and Python, and the Microsoft Office Suite.
Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.
Apply data visualizations through different formats using commercial-off-the-shelf and custom tools.
Grow your communication and technical skills by merging consulting and big data to create data-centric solutions.


Work with us to help drive large-scale business and process decisions through data insights.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

 You Have:

1+ years of experience with coding in R or Python in a business setting
Experience with ETL and EDA processes to answer questions and solve problems
Experience with visualizing data to identify or communicate key insights
Knowledge of basic concepts in mathematics and statistics
Ability to communicate complex analytical insights to non-technical audience
Ability to think critically, analyze, and actively listen to effectively problem solve
Ability to obtain a Secret clearance
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Business, Economics, or Finance


 Nice If You Have:

Experience with R Shiny, Flask, HTML, and UI and UX centric development
Experience with database development and architecture design
Experience with machine learning, statistical modeling, or optimization algorithms
Experience with data visualization tools, including Tableau, Qlik, or Power BI
Experience with supporting the Army or DoD clients
Possession of Microsoft Excel skills, particularly in financial modeling
Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Chemistry, Business, or another relevant STEM field


 Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

 Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
 Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $60,400.00 to $137,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.
 
 Work Model Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.


 EEO Commitment
We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Vision IT is a fast growing, woman-owned business that's supported DoD and Federal Sector IT initiatives for two decades. We work side-by-side with our clients as a trusted, long-term partner offering innovative consultation and leadership to solve their most pressing and complex problems. We orchestrate people, strategies, technologies and best-of-breed business processes.
Vision IT is looking for an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join our team as an Entry-Level Storage and Data Protection Analyst. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to start a career in IT. No advanced experience is needed, as training will be provided. You will work with a team to manage and support virtual storage systems, networks, and desktops for the Department of Defense (DoD).
 What You'll Learn and Do:

Learn how to manage virtual storage, servers, and networks.
Assist in maintaining secure cloud solutions and virtual desktops for military deployments.
Get hands-on experience with systems like VMWare, Citrix, and Microsoft Hyper-V.
Help monitor and troubleshoot virtual desktops and networks.
Work closely with experienced technicians to keep systems running smoothly.
Support customers by helping solve basic issues with virtual servers and desktops.
Learn how to perform daily checks to ensure systems are operating efficiently.

 Training Provided For:

Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) management.
Storage Area Network (SAN) systems.
Cloud and virtualization technologies.
Networking and server management.

 Minimum Requirements:

Active Secret clearance (required).
Interest in learning IT and virtualization technologies.
Good problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team.
No prior experience required-just a willingness to learn!
This is a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a growing field while being supported by an experienced team. You'll be trained to take on more responsibilities as you gain experience.

Vision IT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class.

*** This position is on-site at our DTLA HQ Office***
PROGRAM SUMMARY:  PACE BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT CENTER (PACE BDC) promotes the growth and economic expansion of diverse Los Angeles communities through the infusion of capital and the provision of business consultation services and financial literacy training. Housed in the PACE Business Development Center (BDC), the Procurement Team assists small businesses in securing contracts from government agencies and private sector companies. PACE is the only Southern California Minority Business Development Agency (MBDA), designated by the U.S. Department of Commerce to promote the growth and global competitiveness of small and minority businesses. PACE is also partnering with Mayor Karen Bass in administering the City’s ProcureLA program, a procurement initiative connecting small and minority businesses to contract opportunities with an emphasis on preparing for the 2028 LA Olympics. https://pacela.org/ https://pacelabdc.org/
 POSITION SUMMARY:  PACE is seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to support the Procurement Department. The Data Analyst will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting on key data related to the department’s activities and outcomes. This position will work closely with the Procurement Manager and senior management to provide insights that will improve program performance, ensure compliance with KPIs, and enhance the effectiveness of procurement strategies for small businesses. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in data tools, and the ability to communicate insights in a clear and actionable way.
RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:

Analyze procurement data to track the performance of the program, ensuring that program outcomes and KPIs are met.
Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide real-time insights into program performance, contract opportunities, client engagement, and departmental efficiency.
Work with the Procurement Team to identify trends and opportunities for improving program performance, including assessing the impact of workshops, counseling sessions, and outreach events.
Maintain and manage the department's data systems, ensuring data accuracy and consistency, particularly in Salesforce and other data management systems.
Support the team by analyzing bid opportunities, success rates, and client performance metrics to inform strategic decisions.
Collaborate with the Procurement Manager and senior leadership to generate regular reports for senior management and external stakeholders.
Assist in preparing presentations and reports for grant and contract compliance.
Evaluate and improve data collection processes to ensure streamlined reporting on the program's objectives and contract outcomes.
Assist in researching market data, identifying procurement trends, and monitoring competitor activities.
Support the team in developing outreach strategies by analyzing client demographics, engagement, and contract success rates.
Provide technical support and training for staff on data management systems and tools.
Assist in managing and updating client information in the CRM system (Salesforce), ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting.

QUALIFICATIONS, EXPERIENCES AND SKILLS:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
At least 2-3 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in procurement, business development, or a similar field.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and data visualization tools.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus.
Experience working with CRM systems such as Salesforce, including generating reports and managing data integrity.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to process large datasets and generate actionable insights.
High attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in an understandable way.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and support various stakeholders.
Experience working with procurement or government contracting data is preferred but not required.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Experience in procurement, sourcing, or contracting environments.
Experience working with small businesses or minority-owned businesses in a procurement capacity.
Experience in preparing data reports for management or government agencies.
Knowledge of procurement processes and compliance regulations in government or private sector contracts.

Other Requirements:

Must have a valid Driver’s License, adequate automobile insurance coverage and an automobile in working condition; local travel may be required.
COVID vaccination required; must have two-dose series of Pfizer or Moderna or a single-dose of Johnson & Johnson. Those that need a medical or religious exemption must reach out separately.
Must satisfactorily pass background and employment/reference check

Application Process:

Please upload resume and complete PACE online application on our website: https://pacela.org/about/work-at-pace/
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until position has been filled.

Physical Demands
These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the Development and Marketing Director. Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions of the position. While performing the responsibilities of this position, the employee is required to talk and hear. The employee is often required to sit and use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, carry up to 30 lbs. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision

  Come Grow with Us and Join an Award-Winning Organization! Stearns Bank is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst. This is a remote-eligible position headquartered out of St. Cloud, Minnesota.
 


 JOB SUMMARY


  The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for designing and creating reports and dashboards, completing analytics projects, and ensuring effective information delivery for business users, both technical and non-technical, across Stearns Bank. This includes collaborating with the Stearns Bank Connect technology team to establish and execute tracking, key business driver reporting, descriptive and diagnostic reporting, and delivering results concisely that drives decision making and strategy based on these findings.
 


 Starting annual salary of $85,000.00. Employment offers will be dependent upon the selected candidate’s relevant qualifications and experience.
 


 RESPONSIBILITIES


Work with business users to capture reporting requirements and translate into a data request.
Identify the appropriate data to investigate, then gather, analyze, and interpret.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize data quality.
Leverage statistical methods to allow for analysis of large volumes of data.
Combine reporting from across multiple platforms to produce consistent reports.
Identify, communicate, and resolve data quality issues.
Work with vendors to gather vital data and reporting information.
Build reports & presentations that use data visualization and graphics to inform and influence decision makers.
Innovate operational improvements that enable efficient delivery and maintenance with consistent direction.
Interact with software developers, operations, and business unit teams to plan testing for delivery of products and enhancements and to assure products meet product requirements and quality standards.
Collaborate with fellow BI team members to develop performance indicators and reporting that allow for quantification of projects and their results.
Handle ad-hoc requests to create specialized reports based on user specific requirements.



 REQUIREMENTS


Occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 lbs.
Literacy in English.
Ability to sit for extended periods of time, twist, bend, sit, walk use hands to twist, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls, such as computer mouse, computer keyboard, calculator, stapler, telephone, staple puller, etc., reach with hands and arms, balance, stoop, kneel, talk, or hear.
Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.



 QUALIFICATIONS



Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics or related field preferred; professional experience and/or certifications in a related field will be considered in lieu of formal education.



3+ years of analytics, data science, business intelligence.
Related experience in a Finance or Banking environment is preferred, but not required.
Adept at queries, report writing, and data visualization.
Experience in scripting languages such as SQL and Python.
Knowledge of warehousing/data storage best practices is desired, but not required.
Creative solving of technical problems to create scalable tools and systems.
Business Process Understanding.



 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Demonstrated dedication to detail and accuracy while having the ability to understand the big picture.
Excellent organization and documentation skills.
Self-motivated learner.
Must have strong ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
High attention to detail is required.
An individual who cultivates a sense of teamwork and pride within the group.


 THE COMPANY
Founded in 1912, Stearns Financial Services Inc. (SFSI) is a $2.4 billion well-capitalized, independent financial holding company based in St. Cloud, Minnesota. Specializing in nationwide small business lending and equipment financing, Stearns has maintained outstanding customer service, fast decisions, and customized finance solutions to their customers for decades.
Stearns Bank has earned itself a stellar reputation amongst customers and competitors alike. This reputation goes beyond just word-of-mouth, as Stearns has been recognized by the Independent Community Banker’s Association (ICBA) as a top-performing bank in the nation based on a 3-year average Return on Assets for banks $1 billion or more. Stearns has also been recognized by American Banker as a top-performing bank in the nation over a 3-year period for Return on Equity for banks from $2 billion to $10 billion.
As a Star Tribune Top Workplaces award recipient and an award recipient of the Minnesota Business Magazine 100 Best Places to Work in Minnesota, Stearns takes pride in their team and holds their employees in extremely high regard. We offer a competitive salary and benefit package including our Employee Stock Ownership Program-one of the best long-term incentive programs in the nation.
 EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER /AFFIRMATIVE ACTION PLAN
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, or creed, religion, sex, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran’s status, status with regard to public assistance, or any other class protected by Federal, State, local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment.

Job Overview
The Customer Data Analyst is responsible for identifying and analyzing data regarding our customers and prospective customers, making recommendations, and providing insight to Citadel leadership in critical decision-making that drives attainment of strategic and business objectives, including growth and sales. The Analyst will be responsible for designing and delivering Use Cases to support the development of Citadel’s next generation Data & Analytics platform. Each Use Case is designed to support the business and deliver an improved customer and/or employee experience and will include the requirements, data definition, report and dashboard design, and end user rollout.
 Duties and Responsibilities

Collaborate with Finance, Marketing, Retail, Digital Sales, Product teams and other Citadel business leaders to determine and prioritize needs for customer data.
Develop Use Cases – partner with the business to capture and document Business Requirements, Business Definitions, Data Definitions, Visual Requirements, and Test Scripts.
Apply various analytic methods to discover and interpret information about customer and prospective customer behavior from multiple data sources, including Citadel’s website, customer account data, data from external partners, and other sources
Integrate data across sources
Collaborate with IT to develop or adopt relational databases
Create actionable insights based on customer data, both proactively and in response to requests
Recommend target segments and campaigns/offers
Maintain necessary processes, controls and procedures to ensure data accuracy and business functionality and comply with privacy and security policies and regulations.
Lead and participate in cross-functional teams for corporate sales, marketing, customer service, and product development
Be an expert in data visualization to help the organization grow in data literacy
Perform regular analysis and reports for distribution to senior management on customer/prospective customer data and trends.
Develop analytical reports to various departments requesting insight, supportive data or status reports to support corporate initiatives
Use internal and external data to identify key target segments that will be most likely to respond to marketing tactics, generating product sales effectively and efficiently.
Document processes with Runbooks for audit control and substitution work

Qualification & Education Requirements

3+ years related data management and analysis experience, including experience in consumer behavior data mining and analysis
Retail banking or other financial services experience
Experience with marketing, sales, or customer service, including digital and traditional
Bachelor’s degree required
Proficiency in specialized database software
Writing SQL queries to solve business problems
Proficiency creating reports and dashboards in a modern data visualization tool (Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (CRM experience, Python or R, preferred)
Experience with database documentation (Data Dictionaries and Entity Relationship Diagrams)

Additional Skills/ Notes

Demonstrated ability to break down and analyze multi-dimensional business and technical issues. Experience in integrating information from a variety of resources, formats and systems.
Excellent analytical skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills. Demonstrate adaptability when interacting with internal clients. Maintain confidentiality, promote integrity, and support the corporate mission.
Ability to collaborate on and occasionally lead projects.
Agile project management
Ability to commute to Corporate Headquarters and maintain a hybrid schedule

Citadel will not be considering applications who are located outside the 100 mile radius of our Exton, PA office.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

  Job Description:
 


  Data Analyst, Field Operations
 


  Ryan US, Inc. has an immediate career opportunity for a Data Analyst to join our team! This individual will play a crucial role in supporting the data and analytics needs of our Construction teams focusing on scheduling and field operations. In this position, you will be responsible for finding meaningful connections and insights in all levels of company data that will drive smarter business decisions.
 


  Ryan is known as an industry leader who brings a fully integrated and creative design-build approach to each new project, alongside almost 85 years of experience. We strive to be a trusted advisor to each client by providing creative, accurate, and timely solutions to the ever-changing world of commercial real estate.
 

  Some things you can expect to do:
 



    Provide data analytics support for construction operations focusing on scheduling and field operations across all regions and product types.
   


    Become a subject matter expert in datasets related to scheduling and field operations.
   


    Assist Field Operations with scrubbing project data upon project completion for accurate as-built records for archiving.
   


    Build, test, maintain, and train on dashboards where analysis / trends are communicated.
   


    Organize data with the following goals in mind: accuracy, speed of access, ease of access, and flexibility. Identify patterns or trends to support core operational decisions.
   


    Influence existing data collection processes by recommending improvements, workflow modifications, systems, or tool enhancements to ensure quality data.
   


    Ensure data quality and accuracy through ongoing data validation, cleansing and enrichment activities. Includes addressing privacy and security components.
   


    Work in a team setting and collaborate with other data analysts and technology partners.
   


    Work closely with business leaders to understand their data analysis needs and provide insights and recommendations to inform decision-making.
   



  To be successful in this role, you must have:
 




    A bachelor’s degree in data analytics, data science or a business-related field of study and 3-5 years of Analyst or equivalent work experience.
   


    You must also have experience with data visualization tools, data querying (SQL) and data interpretation skills.
   


    A successful candidate will possess strong communication skills, comfort with ambiguity, and the ability to learn in a fast-paced collaborative environment.
   


 You will really stand out if you:
 



    Have experience with Microsoft Power BI, SQL Server and Microsoft Suite.
   


    Have previous experience in construction operations.
   


    Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
   


    Knowledge of data modeling techniques and database design principles.
   


    Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and seek out new opportunities for creativity and innovation.
   


    Have a strong ability to connect new technology with the needs of the organization.
   





    Eligibility:
   



      Positions require verification of employment eligibility to work in the U.S.
     


      Must be authorized to work in the U.S.

    The annual salary range is $84,900 - $106,200 per year . The salary may vary within the anticipated range based on factors such as the ultimate location of the position and the selected candidate’s knowledge, skills, and abilities. Position may be eligible for additional compensation that may include commission and/or an incentive program.

Position Highlights


     The Accelerating Secure IT Services (ASITS) program is a comprehensive effort dedicated to reshaping and strengthening IT operations, security, and services across the University of Arizona. Working with our campus IT partners, we have engaged in a thorough assessment of current capabilities, needs, and gaps. The ASITS team will use this suite of robust data to increase alignment of the university's IT infrastructure and processes to establish clear pathways for collaboration. We are seeking to provide increased access to technology tools, support, procedures, and provide a continuity of operations.
The Data Analyst designs, develops, and maintains data extracts, queries, reports, surveys, statistical models, and visualizations, using advanced analytical tools to inform decision making related to both the IT Restructure and Accelerating Secure IT Services (ASITS) programs. The position ensures accuracy and efficiency of output and makes recommendations consistent with findings.
 This is an Extended Temporary Position with an expected end date of June 30, 2025.
 This position may allow for remote or hybrid work from within the state of Arizona. Incumbent will need to reside in Arizona
 Outstanding UA benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays; UA/ASU/NAU tuition reduction for the employee and qualified family members; retirement plans; access to UA recreation and cultural activities; and more!
The University of Arizona has been recognized for our innovative work-life programs.




Duties & Responsibilities



Design, develop, and maintain data extracts, queries, reports, surveys, statistical models, and visulalizations, using advanced analytical tools to inform decision making related to IT Restructure and ASITS programs.
Apply data visualization through different formats such as graphs, tables, and PowerPoint slides.
Produce routine and ad hoc reports for UITS Executive Leadership and program teams.
Gather requirements to determine the specifics of what is being asked and seek consultation when unique issues are presented.
Works collaboratively across multiple units and with a variety of stakeholders who rely on data analyses for decision support.
Evaluate or interpret data, including identification of patterns or trends, and present findings to assist with or influence strategic decisions.
Serve as a functional expert and resource regarding IT Restructure and ASITS data, offering recommendations for appropriate data research strategies that will produce information for use by Program leaders and UITS Executives.
Ensure analysis are consistent with federal, state, and university regulations while applying high ethical standards in ensuring that the data is presented with integrity.
Develop and maintain database for ASITS and IT Restructure data. Serve as the data owner for this information.





Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's degree AND 5 years of relevant work experience; OR,
Equivalent combination of education and work experience.




Preferred Qualifications


3+ years of experience with data analysis.
Experience using SQL, Tableau, Power BI, Microsoft Excel.
Experience using dashboard and data visualization principles, theories and concepts.
Experience developing models and simulations and synthesizing information into quantitative and qualitative assessments to support senior leader decision-making.

Diversity Statement


     At the University of Arizona, we value our inclusive climate because we know that diversity in experiences and perspectives is vital to advancing innovation, critical thinking, solving complex problems, and creating an inclusive academic community. As a Hispanic-serving institution, we translate these values into action by seeking individuals who have experience and expertise working with diverse students, colleagues, and constituencies. Because we seek a workforce with a wide range of perspectives and experiences, we provide equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. As an Employer of National Service, we also welcome alumni of AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service programs and others who will help us advance our Inclusive Excellence initiative aimed at creating a university that values student, staff and faculty engagement in addressing issues of diversity and inclusiveness.
    



Notice of Availability of the Annual Security and Fire Safety Report


     In compliance with the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act (Clery Act), each year the University of Arizona releases an Annual Security Report (ASR) for each of the University’s campuses. These reports disclose information including Clery crime statistics for the previous three calendar years and policies, procedures, and programs the University uses to keep students and employees safe, including how to report crimes or other emergencies and resources for crime victims. As a campus with residential housing facilities, the Main Campus ASR also includes a combined Annual Fire Safety report with information on fire statistics and fire safety systems, policies, and procedures.  Paper copies of the Reports can be obtained by contacting the University Compliance Office at cleryact@arizona.edu.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Business Analyst will support the bank by analyzing business needs, identifying opportunities for improvement, and facilitating the implementation of effective solutions. This role involves collaboration with various stakeholders to ensure that business processes are efficient and aligned with the bank's objectives. The Business Analyst will ensure that requirements are accurately transcribed into user stories or business requirements templates and will help support the refinement and testing of product deliverables. This position also serves as a stepping stone to a Product Owner role, and will provide exposure to product development and management.
 Responsibilities:

Requirements Gathering: Engage with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements, ensuring a clear understanding of their needs and translating them into actionable user stories or business requirements documents
Process Improvement: Assess business processes and requirements to recommend improvements to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve service quality
Documentation: Create detailed documentation, including business requirements documents, user stories, acceptance criteria, and process flows
Stakeholder Communication: Facilitate communication between technical teams and business units to ensure alignment on product goals and deliverables
Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users on new systems or processes, ensuring smooth adoption
Testing and Validation: Collaborate with QA teams to develop test plans and validate solutions
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that all processes and solutions comply with banking regulations and standards

 Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Knowledge of banking operations, regulations, and compliance
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and product management frameworks
Experience with business process modeling tools
Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) or Agile (e.g., Certified Scrum Product Owner) is a plus.

 Education, Training, and Experience:

Bachelors degree in Finance, Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field
3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in the banking or financial services sector

 Overview:

 Primary Functions: A Senior Data Analyst takes on a leadership role and provides input into strategic decisions about reporting solutions, architecture, and technology. They take ownership of business lines and become an expert in that area. In short, they become a strategic partner with their business customers. They excel in query writing and report building and designing and implementing end-to-end reporting solutions. They ensure best practices, maintain standards, and play a key role in shaping the organization's business analysis function.
 


 Duties and Responsibilities:


Works independently with Business users and domain SMEs to understand requirements.
Defines and maintains data models (dimensional models with conformed dimensions, entity relational models), and Data Vault models to satisfy analytics requirements.

Assists in developing governance processes around data management and the warehouse development.
Maintains in-depth knowledge of credit union operations and knowledge of current industry trends as well as current methods and technologies that relate to Data Warehousing, data preparation, data presentation practices and operations.
Provides project management for assigned BI projects.
Prepares and presents business proposals, recommendations, evaluations and selections of data preparation and integration tools, DQ and MDM tools and processes.
Performs other duties as assigned.

 Experience/Skills: Strong oral, written, administrative, organizational, and inter-personal skills. The ability to analyze problems, develop alternatives and recommendations. Financial Services experience and familiarity of big data concepts is a plus.

Job Description:

 Investment Data Analyst, Data Strategy-SAI 

Description
The Investment Data Analyst role will be responsible for providing scalable, timely, easily consumable and good quality data for consumption by SAI led products and functions. This position will help drive and define strategy for data analysis, management, acquisition, and distribution. Working closely with SAI business as well as technology partners, the position will participate on projects of various size and complexity, including product/platform development and enhancement.

 Primary Responsibilities: 

Develop and implement a repeatable process aimed at streamlining the data sourcing, aggregation, quality & distribution
Research, recommend and implement automation, digitization, and new scalable solutions for distributing data.
Partner with members of business and technology teams to develop Project and Execution Plans, establish agreed-upon milestones and raise issues, as necessary. Ensure timely production and meet calendar deadlines.
Participate in other data-related efforts to support ad-hoc reporting and analysis.
Operationally monitor, govern, and triage data issues arising from nightly batch or real time data sourcing, working with internal and external partners and vendors.

 Education and Experience:

We are seeking a highly motivated, proactive professional with excellent data and interpersonal skills who are eager to learn about asset management!
1-3 years or more in a data intensive, hands on environment, preferably within investment management or technology industries!
Bachelor's Degree required (completed or in progress)!

 Skills and Knowledge: 

Good data querying skills using SQL, TOAD, Tableau, Excel, or any other applications.
Introductory experience with system development projects, business analysis, and data analysis.
Basic knowledge of asset allocation investment products, Performance, Attribution, Fixed Income and Risk related experience.
Prior Experience with Reporting and Visualization Tools like Tableau, Spotfire, Alteryx or other BI, Data Prep, Blending etc.
Basic understanding of AI/ML concepts, R, Python or Scala is preferred.
Exposure to Private Equity, Private Debt and Private Real Assets data, vendors and investment processes. Any experience with vendors like Preqin, Blue Vault, Pitchbook, Burgiss, Cliffwater etc. is a big plus.
Understanding of MS Excel (macros, VLOOKUP’s, VBA) and PowerPoint
Basic project management skills and ability to prioritize multiple work streams, track progress and effectively communicate and handle expectations.
Basic analytical skills and business judgment.
Intellectual curiosity and commitment to continuous improvement.
Interest in CFA / CAIA / Financial Certification is good to have but not required.

 The base salary range for this position is $76,000-$144,000 per year.
  Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate’s relevant experience, and other factors.

Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.

 Company Overview
Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.
Join Us
At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.
Fidelity’s hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Working onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of every other week in a Fidelity office.
At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

Are you a math guru, love to look at spreadsheets and analyze data? Then we may have an opportunity for you! We are looking for a driven, self-motivated, mathematically-focused individual, who is ready and willing to learn new things and ultimately become an expert at rating vehicle lines of business.
 Who We Are: With Farm Bureau Financial Services, our client/members can feel confident knowing their family, home, cars, other property and businesses are protected. We value a culture where integrity, teamwork, passion, service, leadership and accountability are at the heart of every decision we make and every action we take. Acquire and examine data from multiple sources, apply actuarial concepts to analyze data, and provide insight with suggested conclusions.

Automate current processes.

 What is takes to join our team:

A College degree (including coursework in mathematics), or equivalent
Must have knowledge and working experience with spreadsheets and be able to apply to actuarial related problems.
Proven decision making and analytical skills, with the ability to analyze and resolve difficult problems.
Must be a self-starter who is detail-oriented and able to prioritize multiple tasks.

Add to that an onsite wellness facility with fitness classes and programs, a daycare center, a cafeteria, and even an onsite medical clinic. If your values align with ours, we invite you to join Farm Bureau Financial Services…where the grass really IS greener!
 Work Authorization/Sponsorship Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.  Overview: 
 Position Summary:
The Sr. Data Analyst, Marketing, will work closely with multiple stakeholders, including media and advertising agencies, Product, Customer and Agent Experience, Sales Development, and Enterprise Data & Analytics, to deliver world-class advanced data analyses of marketing paid, earned and owned campaigns and initiatives and estimate their impact on company KPIs. This person will demonstrate thought leadership that contributes to channel optimization, effective multi-variant testing, increased audience reach, insightful analysis, and overall campaign performance. This person will create and maintain performance-based dashboards and help provide actionable insights.

 This role will contribute to the evolution of marketing analytics within Mercury, evaluating and implementing new applications for measurement, optimization, personalization and user acquisition across all marketing channels including collaborating on the design and launch of attribution modeling. The ideal candidate contributes to all aspects of marketing, including strategy, vision, execution and management of marketing technology and data.

 State specific pay scales for this role are as follows:
$83,395 to $154,017 (CA, NJ, NY, WA, HI, AK, MD, CT, RI, MA)
$75,813 to $140,016 (NV, OR, AZ, CO, WY, TX, ND, MN, MO, IL, WI, FL, GA, MI, OH, VA, PA, DE, VT, NH, ME)
$68,232 to $126,014 (UT, ID, MT, NM, SD, SE, KS, OK, IA, AR, LA, MS, AL, TN, KY, IN, SC, NC, WV)

 The expected base salary for this position will vary depending on a number of factors, including relevant experience, skills and location.
 Responsibilities: Essential Job Functions:
 

Define, build, and maintain reporting to monitor performance of paid and organic media efforts across multiple platforms.
Drive actionable insights and recommendations in an easy to digest manner and communicate key insights across all levels of the organization.
Use Python, SQL, dbt, and Power BI to create and maintain analytical infrastructure and reporting including dashboard creation and management for business users.
Drive analysis of marketing channel performance and interactions across the customer buying journey, partnering with other data organizations within the company to identify opportunities for optimization in media mix, content, website and app experiences.
Help measure the impact and effectiveness of various marketing campaigns, including TV, outdoor, digital (video, display, etc.), direct mail, PR, content marketing, SEO, social, lead gen, and SEM.
Utilize survey and voice of customer data to report on brand trust and awareness.
Execute A/B/n testing and evaluation strategies to help improve business results.
Work in partnership with teams developing marketing & media mix attribution model solutions to inform marketing spend allocations and partners for future campaigns.
Collaborate with internal and external resources to streamline and establish standard procedures for database manipulation and report/output preparation.
Collaborate with data governance teams to champion consistent metrics throughout the company.
Continually evaluate data efficiencies and areas for automation.
Provide analysis to better understand implementation options for analytical models/procedures, and work closely with other groups through implementation processes.
Merge online and offline data, including service and support interactions to enable accurate attribution and campaign effectiveness measurement.
Collaborate with Customer and Agent Experience and Data Analytics to implement journey, behavioral and emotional analytics to uncover marketing and customer experience optimization opportunities. Help support the establishment of the role of such metrics in the overall marketing measurement program.
Support the creation of a single view of prospect and customer data that includes anonymous or known behavioral and experiential measurement and indicators
Act as the primary Marketing stakeholder in the implementation of a customer data platform that supports data collection, profile building (including ID resolution and ID graphs) and segmentation, and marketing activation across multiple channels.

 Qualifications: Education:

Bachelor's degree with analytical concentration in mathematics, statistics, engineering, computer science, finance, etc., or equivalent experience.
Master’s degree preferred.

 Experience:

6+ years data analysis experience.
4+ years A/B/n testing for digital and direct marketing.

 Knowledge and Skills:

Strength and proven track record in identifying new market opportunities, translating complex business needs into innovative solutions, helping define and execute marketing strategies and roadmaps.
Expert in reporting on media spend, efficiency, and optimization and its influence on owned and earned media.
Experience with data visualization platforms and web apps (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, R Shiny, Steamlit, Google Data Studio) with strong visual dashboard design skills.
Experienced user of Salesforce. Candidate must be adept at creating custom report types and proficient in report building – full understanding of native Salesforce objects and capabilities.
Expert knowledge of digital analytics and tools.
Familiarity with brand metric tracking platforms, such as The Harris Poll.
Experience designing, executing, and measuring marketing A/B/n tests.
Solid knowledge and experience with CDPs and marketing measurement tools.
Expertise in writing complex SQL queries and dbt models to combine datasets across multiple sources.
Experience building ELT pipelines using dbt or similar tools to support analytical processes.
Experience using version control platforms like GitHub/GitLab
Fluency in media technology, ad serving platforms, and marketing data systems.
Passion and proven track record in using technology to help solve complex business problems.
Understanding of industry trends relating to cookies, consent and privacy and their impact on marketing effectiveness.
Working knowledge of server-side integrations and ad tag implementation and management (Adobe Launch, Tealium) a plus.

 Join an amazing team that is consistently recognized for our achievements and culture, including our most recent Forbes award of being one of America's Best Midsize Employers for 2024!

 Why choose a career at Mercury?
At Mercury, we have been guided by our purpose to help people reduce risk and overcome unexpected events for more than 60 years. We are one team with a common goal to help others. Everyone needs insurance and we can’t imagine a world without it.

About The Team
The Subscriber Data Intelligence team is looking for a Lead Data Analyst who will help to measure, understand, and take action to mitigate subscriber churn across a growing ecosystem of Disney’s streaming service offerings (Disney+, Hulu, and ESPN+). Our team masters exploratory data analysis, advanced reporting, data visualization and storytelling to deliver actionable insights and provide recommendations to drive business decision-making. This team collaborates cross-functionally across the Direct to Consumer organization as well as with stakeholders from business units across The Walt Disney Company to generate insightful, compelling, and strategic analyses. This role will build strong relationships and partner closely with Finance, Business Operations, Business Strategy, and other Analytics teams to ensure the business understands complex retention trends and implications for strategic decision making. The team’s work will drive the development of business and operational plans that are expected to have broad influence at all levels of the organization.



 Responsibilities



Communicate complex trends and churn drivers to a wide array of business stakeholders with varying technical expertise from operational teams to executive audiences, both in oral presentations and via written reports




Partner closely with business stakeholders (Product, Business Operations, Finance, Marketing etc.) to identify and unlock opportunities for improved subscriber retention




Create and maintain operational dashboards in Tableau and Looker to understand performance over time, enable efficient exploratory analysis, and equip partners with self-serve tools




Translate complex business questions into SQL including proper cohorting, calculations, filtering criteria and/or aggregations




Partner with Data Science teams to uplevel analyses using clustering/segmentation, regression modeling, and/or predictive modeling




 Required Qualifications





Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or related field




7+ years of strategic analysis to inform product or business decision making




5+ years of hands-on analytical work experience with SQL (ETL ownership, complex transformations, development of “analytical” datasets)




Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendations




Ability to think strategically, analyze and interpret first and third party information




Experience manipulating large data sets and interpreting data trends using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools




Expertise with data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau or Looker




Strong analytical and technical skills to troubleshoot issues, analyze the cause, quickly come-up with possible solutions, document the changes, and communicate organizational impact




Strong experience in documenting the data requirements, data strategy, data rules (standardization, cleansing, and validation)




 Desired Qualifications



Experience in the streaming media industry and/or supporting a direct-to-consumer or subscription-based product




Experience in the technology industry and knowledge of how to build and implement data products




Experience presenting data stories to executive audiences




Experience operating in an SDLC environment and deploying code


 Additional Information

Welcome to the intersection of energy and home services. At NRG, we’re driven by the idea of a smarter, cleaner, more connected future—and the possibilities that will bring to the world and to the 7.3 million customers we serve.

 Vivint Smart Home, an NRG owned company, is a leading smart home company in the United States, dedicated to redefining the home experience with intelligent products and services. Talent Operations is responsible for providing both strategic guidance and tactical support in the administration and support of policies, procedures, and systems, in support of the NRG Talent & Culture vision. Members of the organization will act primarily as internal consultants who are responsible for representing the business in terms of the following activities: understanding and communicating business requirements, assuring policies and procedures are followed, and systems are being used in accordance with the rules and structures as designed. Communication, training, and the infrastructure to support both, are also core components of the role that team members share. Additionally, key responsibilities are as follows:

 Job description
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Talent Analytics Analyst to join our dynamic Talent & Culture team. In this role, you will leverage data analysis and statistical techniques to provide actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making and enhance our workforce initiatives. You will work closely with Talent & Culture and business leaders to identify trends, improve employee experiences, and optimize talent management processes.

 Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis: Collect, analyze, and interpret talent data from various sources, including employee surveys, performance metrics, and turnover statistics.
Reporting: Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key talent metrics, including recruitment, retention, diversity, talent operations and employee engagement.
Trend Identification: Identify patterns and trends in talent data to inform strategic initiatives and support business goals.
Predictive Modeling: Utilize statistical techniques and predictive analytics to forecast workforce trends and inform talent strategies.
Collaboration: Partner with Talent & Culture teams to design and implement data-driven programs that enhance employee performance and satisfaction.
Presentation: Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through clear and compelling presentations.
Continuous Improvement: Stay current with industry trends and best practices in talent analytics and HR technology to drive innovation within the team.


 Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Analytics, Statistics, or a related field
2+ years of experience in talent analytics, data analysis, or a related field.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and statistical software (e.g., R, Python, SPSS) is a plus.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and translate findings into actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present data to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Experience with HRIS and other HR-related software is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


 WORKING CONDITIONS: 
This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones.

 SAFETY:
 Vivint enforces a safety culture whereby all employees have the responsibility for continuously developing and maintaining a safe working environment. Each new employee is responsible for completing all training requirements. Additionally, the employee must accept they have responsibility for maintaining the safety of themselves, their co-workers, and the public. Employee must adhere to all written and verbal instructions, promptly report and correct all hazards or unsafe conditions, question non-standard operations or unmitigated hazards, and provide feedback to management on all safety issues.
