From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we enrich the quality of life the world over. Learn more at www.adm.com.

  POSITION: Master Data Specialist
 

  DEPARTMENT: Finance
 

  REPORTS TO: (Finance) Master Data Manager
 

  FLSA STATUS: Salaried
 


  Job Summary
 


  As the world’s leading venue management company and producer of live event experiences, ASM Global is the preeminent management and content partner with over 350 venues worldwide. Operating and investing in the world’s most important stadiums, arenas, convention centers, and theaters requires unmatched dedication and the most profound expertise. Our focus is YOU! Through investments in growth, resources, and technology we strive to enhance the experience of our internal Team Members and to continue creating amazing live experiences for the guests that we serve.
 

  As a member of the Corporate Finance team, the Master Data Specialist focuses on maintaining the financial data architecture in support of financial processes and systems in the ASM Global organization. The position also supports the ASM Global Dynamics 365 Team with the Company’s implementations and future rollouts of D365 to its affiliated companies and is a trusted source of expertise for our business and financial personnel.
 


  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 

Assist Master Data and cross-functional teams with the financial data architecture, including dimension member and hierarchy maintenance across financial systems
Management and maintenance of master data across lines of business including vendors and customers to support MDM goals and objectives
Test, deploy and maintain data integrations, ETL processes, within finance environments
Perform Master Data additions, changes, and deletions according to standard procedures and business rules
Understand data migration requirements
Acquire understanding of Microsoft D365 F&O to support Master Data Team and end users
Ensure requests for master data maintenance are properly authorized/approved by working with appropriate Company data owners
Work across teams to investigate data-related issues, seeking to provide timely and productive support and solutions
Educate clients on master data processes and business requirements
Maintain required audit-related documentation



  Required Qualifications
 

Experience working with advanced ERP environments (Dynamics 365 F&O a plus) and FP&A systems (deFacto or BPC is a plus)
Strong analytical and detail-oriented aptitude; a high degree of accuracy is required
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and MS Office applications
Experience designing and working with financial controls
Ability to identify and manage priorities
Excellent critical-thinking and problem-solving skills
Verbal and written communication and presentation skills



  Required Education and Experience
 

Minimum education; Associate degree in finance or accounting (or equivalent experience)
2+ years of related work experience with ERP systems (Microsoft Dynamics, Business Central, SAP, Oracle, JDE, Sage) and financial data architectures
Beneficial training Six Sigma or Lean



  NOTE:
 

  ASM Global is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and encourages Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities, and protected Veterans to apply. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
 


  The essential responsibilities of this position are described under the headings above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Also, this document in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position.

The Accountability Data Analyst is responsible for data analysis, analytics, and reporting information impacting school accountability, evaluation, and performance.

 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Accountable for basic and complex statistical analysis
Create and maintain data files to analyze data and report information to meet critical district priorities
Create spreadsheets, charts, and graphs to conduct and illustrate trend analysis
Transform/compile data from a variety of sources and format into data acceptable for analysis
Analyze and interpret large and complex data sets and metrics
Works in collaboration with the Research and Assessment team
Conduct a review of high-priority data files to make required corrections reported to Core Data and School Leadership
Transform data from a variety of sources and formats into data acceptable for analysis software and spreadsheet analyses
Synthesize information from multiple resources, conduct trend analyses, and prepare charts and graphs to illustrate data trends
Design and develop standard, ad-hoc, and custom accountability reports as needed for reporting, evaluation, and analysis for various stakeholders
Evaluate the quality of data, troubleshoot, and make necessary adjustments
Evaluate the strengths, weaknesses, and limitations of given datasets or metrics

Must hold a bachelor’s degree or job-related experience
Three years’ experience in educational data analysis and problem-solving with large amounts of data
Knowledge of research and evaluation design, including application of appropriate statistical procedures, data analysis, and interpretation of results
Experience in the use of Microsoft computer applications and statistical analysis software (SPSS preferred)


 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s degree or job-related experience within a specialized field of Student Information Systems, preferably Infinite Campus

Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments - creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them. You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day.
 Job Track Description:
Health & Welfare Benefits Administration Services Analyst
Are you ready to support senior analysts and consultants in managing client accounts to ensure optimal benefit plan administration?
Can you confidently analyze data, research compliance issues, and evaluate benefit plans to contribute to client satisfaction?
 About the Role:
Join us as a Health and Welfare Benefits Services Administration Analyst, where you'll play a crucial role in supporting senior analysts and consultants in managing client accounts. You'll be responsible for tasks such as requesting and analyzing data, researching compliance issues, and evaluating benefit plans and programs. Additionally, you'll participate in presentations and respond to client needs as appropriate.
 Responsibilities:

Managing specific H&I cyclical operation tasks for Active, COBRA, and Retiree populations.
Handling areas such as Retirement Eligibility, Long Term Disability, Leave of Absence, Medicare, and more.
Overseeing processes and serving as the point of contact for some file transmissions, user acceptance testing, and issue analysis.
Collaborating with international team members to share knowledge, identify root causes, and resolve issues.
Interacting with clients and vendors to address inquiries and ensure smooth operations.
Actively seeking opportunities for process enhancement and automation to mitigate risk and improve efficiency.


 Requirements:

Possessing strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Demonstrating excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Having the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.
Being proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.
Having experience in data analysis and process improvement.
Being comfortable working with new technology and learning new skills as needed.
Bachelor’s degree desired but not required.
Two years of experience working within H&I administration and/or analysis and process improvement.
Prior experience supporting a client with unions is helpful

Flexible Working
At Conduent, we want you to be yourself. We recognize that everyone is different and that how people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, you can expect the following working conditions:

Remote work: Enjoy the convenience of working from home and maximize your time by unplugging at the end of your workday.


 Working For You
Perks and rewards designed for you:

Health and Welfare Benefits: Our health and welfare benefits can be tailored to fit you and your family's needs and start on the first day of employment.
Retirement Savings: We will support you as you save for your future.
Employee Discounts: We offer you access to a vast selection of global, national, and local discounts on merchandise, services, travel, and more.
Career Growth Opportunities: We help you thrive, so together, we can grow. We provide opportunities to advance your career with a vast portfolio of businesses and a global footprint.
Paid Training: Earn while you learn and continue to grow with access to award-winning learning platforms throughout your Conduent career.
Paid time off: We provide attractive paid time off packages designed for you to enjoy your life away from work.
Great Work Environment: We are proud of our award-winning culture and the recognition we’ve received for our diversity efforts.

Join Us
At Conduent, we are one team, one mission. We understand that our success is directly related to the success of our associates. We strive to create a culture where you can:  Bring your authentic self to work Grow and thrive, both personally and professionally Make a difference with our clients, in our communities, and with the millions of people we support  When you join Conduent, you are engaged in creating the future - both our company’s and your own. With more than 60,000 associates across 24 countries, we will provide you with the opportunity to grow with a team of people who will challenge and inspire you to be the best!

  Great benefits. Competitive pay. We know these are some of the things people look for in a job.
 

 If you’re the kind of person who believes that honoring and empowering our nation’s veterans is more than just a cause — that it’s a calling — then we’re ready to meet you.
 

  When you join Wounded Warrior Project® (WWP), you’re committing to making a difference. We make a commitment to you, too – helping you to find that spark, ignite your passion to serve, and embark on a career with meaning and purpose.
 


 At WWP™, we recognize our mission cannot be accomplished without our talented teammates, which is why we’re proud to offer benefits such as:
 

A flexible hybrid work schedule (three days in the office, two days’ work from home)
Full medical, dental, and vision coverage for both teammates AND family members
Competitive pay and performance incentives
A fun, mission-focused, and collaborative team environment



 A mission that matters is just the beginning, so if you’re ready to get started, we’re ready for you.

 The Wounded Warrior Project (WWP) Mission Data & Insights Data Analytics team investigates matters of interests to program leadership in a systematic manner to synthesize and communicate data-derived knowledge, increasing collective understanding of WWP program effectiveness across all services to promote the well-being of warriors and their families and expand awareness of the post-9/11 veteran population.
 

 DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
 



    Systematically process large dataset, including but not limited to data processing (data cleaning, transformation, summarization, and analysis). This includes implementing best practices and other appropriate quality assurance procedures to inspect the data for accuracy and quality (such as the presence of outliers, missing data, patterns in missing, nonsensical values etc.).
   


    Transform qualitative and quantitative data, from both structured and unstructured sources for analysis.
   


    Develop and maintain consistent and accurate process documentation in coordination with the Data Analytics team that contributes to the collective systematic approach for planning, collecting, processing, and analyzing data to facilitate consistency, repeatability, and efficiency.
   


    Build and maintain productive and collaborative business relationships with stakeholders across the organization and serve as trusted partner to program teams to ensure a warrior-centric philosophy is demonstrated throughout.
   


    Lead reporting and analytics prepared by the impact evaluation team. Ensure rigor, accuracy, and consistency of analytic methods and data reporting. Perform quality assurance checks on all data-related deliverables to ensure accuracy and validity.
   


    Apply methods of storytelling with data to communicate intent or need that aims to inform program direction for warrior programs and services. This includes preparing non-technical summaries of findings and recommendations that are easily understood and used by lay audiences.
   


    Interpret complex data and generate data driven insights in a clear, effective, and concise manner, leveraging the use of data visualizations that target broad audiences that are both technical and non-technical consumers of information.
   


    Collaborate with Impact Evaluation team and Warrior Research teams to identify relevant data points to communicate to external audiences for marketing materials, executive speaking engagements, and other external facing events to accurately and effectively communicate key points obtained through analysis.
   


    Coordinate data sharing at scale, e.g., via meetings, print and digital materials, for a variety of audiences. Inform business decisions and communicate data clearly. Collaborate with marketing and program leadership as needed.
   


    Identify and recommend opportunities for strategies, tactics, and tools to generate efficiency and consistency.
   


    Work collaboratively with internal and external teams to meet organizational objectives and share learnings and best practices.
   


    Other related duties as assigned.
   



  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES
 



    Strong analytical skills. Demonstrated ability to identify problems, analyze information, evaluate results, and solve problems using the most effective solutions.
   


    Strong organizational and time management skills. Demonstrated ability to adapt to changing priorities and meet deadlines and deliverables under tight time constraints.
   


    Strong written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders, ask critical questions, and obtain pertinent information and details. Demonstrated ability to effectively interpret and explain complex information. Demonstrated ability to anticipate questions and areas of concern and provide solid responses for leadership.
   


    Strong documentation skills. Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy.
   


    Working understanding of best practices to collect, store, manage, share, and use data to inform strategy implementation.
   


    Demonstrated working understanding of data analytics and reporting, and statistical testing using statistical software to support the team and the work.
   


    Demonstrated ability to think creatively and innovatively, based on continuous learning and understanding of technology and trends, and share to take the Impact Evaluation team to the next level. Demonstrated inquisitiveness and listening skills to understand the ‘why’ behind trends and changes.
   


    High energy level. Self- starter: willing to take initiative and collaborate with teammates to work effectively.
   


    Unequivocal commitment to the highest standards of personal and business ethics and conduct.
   


    Mission-driven, guided by core values, and a pleasure to work with.
   



  EXPERIENCE
 


  Requirements
 



    Two years of experience working with data, analytics, interpreting complex data, or reporting data for decision-making.
   


    Two years of experience sharing data via meetings, print and digital materials, and communicating data results to executive leadership.
   



  Preferences
 



    Three years of experience in a non-profit environment or working with military or veteran organizations.
   


    Two years of experience applying analytical methods and familiarity with regression analysis and modeling.
   


    Three years of experience performing statistical tests on data sets using STATA, SAS, R, or other statistical software.
   



  EDUCATION
 


  Requirements
 



    Bachelor’s degree. Equivalent combination of education, experience, training, and certification may be considered in lieu of degree.
   



  Preferences
 



    Master’s degree in informatics, data analytics, business, accounting, economics, finance, or comparable program.
   



  CERTIFICATIONS & LICENSURE
 


  Requirements
 



    None.
   



  Preferences
 



    None.
   



  WORK ENVIRONMENT/PHYSICAL DEMANDS
 



    General office environment; temperature controlled.
   


    Up to 25% travel.

 Data Analytics Analyst, Supply Chain Optimization
 PBF Energy Inc. (NYSE:PBF) is one of the largest independent refiners in North America, operating through its subsidiaries, oil refineries and related facilities. We are seeking a talented Data Analytics Analyst, Supply Chain Optimization to join our team as a pivotal member that would play a key role here at PBF Energy. This role would be located onsite at our Company headquarters in Parsippany, NJ.
 
  The ideal candidate will leverage data-driven insights, predictive analytics, and innovative strategies to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve overall supply chain performance for each regional asset. The position provides direct exposure to several functional groups (including commercial and operations) and allows for direct impact on the growth trajectory of PBF Energy.
 


  PRINCIPLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
 

Utilize advanced data analytics tools and methodologies to gather, process, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, risks, and opportunities within the supply chain
Cross-functional collaboration with logistics, operations, and finance teams to align strategies with broader business objectives
Create dashboards, visual reports, and key performance indicators (KPIs) to communicate findings and insights to operational teams for real-time decision support
Drive continuous improvement initiatives by identifying process inefficiencies and leveraging technology and data to streamline processes
Understand regional market price drivers, local supply/demand balances, market arbitrage economics, and other pertinent market supply information to drive organizational change to improve financial competitiveness in the region
Develop innovative supply strategies using rigorous data analysis and creative problem solving to develop low-cost implementable and sustainable solutions to maximize margin capture growth across region
Actively support management of regional hydrocarbon inventory and facilitate financial risk management analysis
Support corporate-wide initiatives ranging from investment & performance analysis, market entry/new product evaluation, financial/annual plan, and cost allocation
Independently create supply/demand financial & simulation models to evaluate strategic and M&A business opportunities



  JOB QUALIFICATIONS:
 

Bachelor's degree required
1-3 years relevant professional experience, including finance, mathematics, statistical modelling, and/or planning & economics
Expert MS Office Proficiency
Understanding of Power Pivots, Data modelling and DAX language
Basic SQL understanding including ER diagram and query writing
Experience in data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau
Excellent written, oral, and visual communicator with practical business acumen and ability to distill complex information into clear, compelling, action items
Collaborative mindset towards teamwork and new idea generation, understanding stakeholder needs and aligning with shared goals
Disciplined data-based decision making with a focus on improving financial results
Effective planning, organization, and work prioritization
Experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines, and achieving business objectives
Ability to adapt in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, adapting to changing business needs and priorities
High integrity, accountability, and self-awareness
Flexible forward thinker to embrace challenges and change with positive expectations
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Exhibit personal initiative and curiosity while operating with a sense of urgency

Preparing client deliverables (reports, presentations, proposals), finding new and exciting ways to visualize the data that elevates our storytelling

Support multiple projects/priorities and gradually build increased responsibility to become more independent
Participate in mentorship of new Analysts and Interns, including shadowing on projects, providing guidance on tasks throughout the project lifecycle, etc.

Participate in initiatives that support our service line (i.e., growth/new product/employee training & engagement)

BA or BS in marketing, business, communications, or related field

Strong project management skills and ability to juggle multiple projects

The ability to thrive within a team environment and a willingness to contribute to a positive culture

When you join Verizon
You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the V Team Life.

 What you’ll be doing...
Your mission will be to help us properly mine raw data and support key insight propagation that informs decision making across Verizon Business Group. You’ll be analyzing data and creating data visualizations that drive business action. Working across the company, you’ll use your analytical and visualization expertise to identify trends, issues, and opportunities, all with the goal of improving the customer experience and finding ways to make our business even better.

Responsibilities include:

Supporting data analytics for the Digital and Customer Experience team, working to organize data and present it in a manner that is easily interpreted and can be actioned.
Working with multiple sources of data and identifying the best way to connect data sets.
Crafting results presentations and regular communications for senior management that provide key business insights.
Customizing each presentation specific to audiences based on background and knowledge of data presented.
Mining media, customer journey, and lead data to highlight performance and opportunities for improvement.
Turning raw data into logical information for reporting, dashboarding, and visualization.


 What We’re Looking For…

You are good with numbers and you love to dig into data to find the story. Crafting reports and spreadsheets is a fun afternoon for you. You appreciate design and have a keen eye for detail. You understand the importance of accuracy in data analytics and reporting. You are a self-starter and a multitasker who can work independently under tight timelines. You want to make an impact by providing the data that will help improve the experience of our customers. You are well spoken and can articulate findings to a wide variety of stakeholders. You are comfortable working in ambiguity and are open to the unique challenges of working in a fast paced B2B environment.

 You’ll need to have:

Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in an analytical/statistical focused position, ideally related to media, marketing and demand generation.
Experience providing recommendations to stakeholders, partners, and business leadership within a matrixed organization.
Data visualization experience, building visually appealing and compelling presentations.
Experience with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics.
Experience with Excel, PowerPoint, Google Sheets, Google Slides.


 Even better if you have one or more of the following: 

Advanced business degree.
Demonstrated ability to define key business KPIs and establish performance measurement frameworks.
Consulting, market research, or ad agency experience.
Experience with SQL.
Project management experience.
Experience with Tableau, Thoughtspot, Salesforce, Invoca.

Company: Council for the Advancement and Support of Education
Description:
Profile insightsFind out how your skills align with the job descriptionSkillsDo you have experience in Research?YesNoEducationDo you have a Bachelor's degree?YesNo Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your profile.Pay$70,000 - $78,000 a yearJob typeFull-time LocationWashington, DC BenefitsPulled from the full job descriptionDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programHealth insuranceLife insuranceLoan forgivenessPaid holidaysShow morechevron down Full job descriptionCASE is a global not-for-profit and membership association whose vision is to advance education to transform lives and society. Its mission is to inspire, challenge and equip communities of professionals to act effectively and with integrity to champion the success of their institutions. CASE serves over 90,000 advancement practitioners at nearly 3,000 member institutions, advancing education in 72 countries.  Broad and growing communities of professional practice gather under the global CASE umbrella. Currently these include advancement services, alumni relations, communications, fundraising, government relations, institutional leadership and marketing. Individual members are at all stages of their career and may be working in universities, schools, colleges, cultural organizations or other not-for-profits. CASE membership also includes many corporate partners. CASE uses the intellectual capital and professional talents of an army of volunteers to advance its work.  Headquartered in Washington, DC, CASE works across all continents from its regional offices in London, Singapore and Mexico City. CASE works to achieve a seamless experience for all its stakeholders: particularly its members, volunteers and staff. Working together across time zones and borders, CASE staff in all offices seek to make the ambitious OneCASE aspiration a reality.  POSITION PURPOSE  The Research Analyst works as part of CASE’s data and research team, supporting CASE Insights – CASE’s global resource for educational advancement-related metrics, benchmarks, and analytics. The Research Analyst will administer surveys, clean and analyze data, and create tables, charts, and infographics for CASE members, volunteers, and other stakeholders engaged in research initiatives. In FY25, CASE Insights will be utilizing data from a new survey and benchmarking platform for the first time. The Research Analyst will assist with testing of survey functionality, as well as data checking on migrated data to ensure accuracy of data for benchmarking and key findings reports. Research Analyst will work collaboratively on research initiatives with colleagues in CASE’s global offices in Washington D.C., London, Mexico City, and Singapore. Limited conference travel may be required.  Compensation: $70,000 - $78,000 depending on experience. Full-time, exempt level employee are eligible for various benefits including vacation and sick leave, paid holidays, health insurance, dental insurance, life insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance, flexible spending plans, employee assistance plan, legal resources plans, tuition reimbursement, and participation in CASE’s retirement plan. CASE is eligible for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) program.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS  The core functions of this position include but are not limited to the following:  Survey Development and Administration 

Program and administer CASE research studies and benchmarking surveys using various survey instruments and research applications.
Ensure surveys are clear, concise, and designed to effectively capture relevant data.
Incorporate CASE Global Reporting Standards and updates into surveys to facilitate global data analysis and benchmarking.
Track survey participation, monitor survey responses, and provide support to CASE members participating in surveys to ensure data submitted is complete and accurate.
Collaborate with communications and marketing team to maintain survey websites and messaging to members regarding survey recruitment and published findings.
 Data Analysis and Reporting 

Clean and verify survey data and assemble tables, charts, and infographics for key findings reports.
Draft initial text for key findings reports and other research publications.
Help to prepare presentations for webinars and conferences.
 Survey Platform Testing and Data Checking 

Assist CASE Insights team with testing of survey functionality as surveys are migrated to the new survey platform.
Assist with data checking on migrated data to ensure accuracy of data for benchmarking and key findings reports.
 General CASE Insights Support 

Provide support to CASE members with other inquiries related to CASE Insights products and solutions.
Participate in conferences, webinars, and training programs to champion the work of CASE Insights.
 Fiscal Management/Budget Responsibilities/Judicious Use of Resources 

Exercises fiscal responsibility in the utilization of all CASE resources.
 Liaison Responsibilities 

Works cooperatively and diplomatically with all divisions and regions.
Liaises with CASE colleagues in other parts of the world to ensure the best sharing of ideas, expertise and knowledge.
Incorporates tasks and/or projects related to objectives as directed by the CASE Strategic Plan.
Work on global research initiatives and collaborate as needed with colleagues in CASE’s London, Mexico City, and Singapore offices.
 Image Responsibilities 

In keeping with the CASE Values Statement, ensures that CASE is well represented by exercising a high degree of professionalism, accuracy, and ethics, in all activities, services, and products.
 Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the Supervisor.  JOB COMPLEXITY AND KNOWLEDGE  The Research Analyst receives direction from Senior Director, Research, and is expected to work independently. The position interacts with CASE staff from across the world, and may come into contact with senior volunteers, members and other high level external key stakeholders, so discretion, confidentiality, and diplomacy are expected. The Research Analyst will be responsible for his/her own time management and prioritization of tasks to ensure the key responsibilities are met.  Problem Solving and Judgement  High level judgement and problem-solving skills are required, as the incumbent is frequently faced with situations which require immediate action in response to issues and requests. The breadth and depth of understanding of an issue and the key internal/external persons handling the issue, and the way in which the issue is handled, all affect the outcome of the situation.  Professional and Organizational Knowledge 

The position requires that the incumbent quickly develop a deep understanding of CASE, its policies and procedures and an understanding of the culture and regional and divisional interdependencies.
The position requires a deep understanding and respect for the organization’s systems and workflow.
 POSITION REQUIREMENTS  Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in statistics, data science, computer science, information technology, library science, social science, economics, business administration, or related discipline preferred. At least two (2) to three (3) of experience in a research or project management position with experience in survey management, data analysis, report writing, is preferred as well as experience working in a professional environment with a focus on member/customer service. An interest in and an understanding of educational advancement across the regions in which CASE works.  Skills and Abilities:

A demonstrated interest in advancing education in the not-for-profit sector.
A strong commitment to contributing to an organizational culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
An understanding and interest in engaging with a broad range of cultures and countries.
Experience in administration of online surveys, data cleaning and analysis, and reporting.
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Ability to assess and summarize complex information for a variety of audiences.
Must have strong technical proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, specifically Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Proficiency with use of R and Excel for data analysis/visualizations required; PowerBI experience preferred.
Experience conducting secondary research using databases and online tools.
Ability to develop work plans and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, according to budget, deadlines, and the demands of collaboration.
Ability to work as a team player in a rapid response research environment, by assisting with idea formulation, research scoping, project planning, research design, and member support.
A pro-active and can-do attitude, even when working under pressure and with all levels of staff.
Strong written and verbal professional communication skills required.
 Alternative Work Arrangement: After 4 weeks of employment, eligible staff are given the opportunity to work from home up to 2 days per week and in-office 3 days per week.  Management reserves the right to review and revise this document at any time. This document represents a description of intended job content, and should not be construed in any way to be a contract of employment.  Thank you for your interest. Only the selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.

 Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.
  Job Summary Responsible for working cross-functionally to collect data and develop models to determine trends utilizing a variety of data sources. Retrieves, analyzes and summarizes data in order to develop business intelligence, optimize effectiveness, predict business outcomes and decision-making purposes. Involved with numerous key business decisions by conducting the analyses that inform our business strategy. This may include: impact measurement of new products or features, optimization of business processes through robust A/B testing, clustering or segmentation of customers to identify opportunities of differentiated treatment, deep dive analyses to understand drivers of key business trends and development of frameworks to drive upsell strategy for existing customers by balancing business priorities with customer activity. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.
  Job Description
Core Responsibilities Works with business leaders and stakeholders to understand data and analysis needs and develop technical requirements. Determines relevancy of data and identifies alternative data sources as needed to ensure analytics requested by business stakeholders can be completed. Analyzes large, complex data to determine actionable business insights using self-service analytics and reporting tools. Queries disparate big data platforms such as Teradata, SQL Server, Hadoop, and AWS. Combines data as needed from disparate data sources to complete analysis. Identifies key business drivers and insights by conducting exploratory data analysis and hypothesis testing. Develops forecasting models to predict sales, demand and other key business metrics. Analyzes the results of campaigns, offers or initiatives to measure their effectiveness and identifies opportunities for improvement. Communicates findings clearly and concisely through narrative-driven presentations and effective data visualizations (Tableau and Think Cell) company executives and decisionmakers. Promotes and evangelizes a culture of excellence, data driven discussions, healthy skepticism, intellectual curiosity, knowledge sharing, and teamwork. Stays current with emerging trends in analytics, statistics, and machine learning and applies them to business challenges. Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance. Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.  Employees at all levels are expected to: Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job. Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services. Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences. Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas. Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers. Drive results and growth. Respect and promote inclusion & diversity. Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.

Position Overview

  Obra Capital is seeking an Analyst, ABS to join our New York office. The purpose of this role is evaluate various consumer and esoteric ABS securities and present findings to the investment committee. The ideal candidate will have 2+ years in the ABS space with experience evaluating products such as auto loans, consumer loans, solar loans, home improvement loans, credit card receivables, small business loans preferred.
 


 Obra Capital, Inc. is a specialized alternative asset management firm that provides investment products and solutions across insurance special situations, structured credit, asset-based finance, and longevity. The firm aims to generate long-term value and attractive returns for investors through a variety of vertically integrated commingled funds and separate accounts. With capabilities in investing, originating, structuring, and servicing, Obra provides differentiated investment opportunities and capital solutions for investors globally. For more information about Obra, please visit www.obra.com.
 


 Responsibilities
 

Valuations of public and privately traded structured credit products.
Performing rigorous qualitative and quantitative analysis on ABS and other structured credit products for investment recommendations.
Analyze data tapes and loan files
Work with deal team to source investments in the structured credit space
Draft and present investment screening memos
Conduct and monitor portfolio and performance analytics on an ongoing basis
Develop cash flow models, performing deep dive due diligence on
Drive communication with counsel and rating agencies on documentation and transaction execution
Interface with multiple functional groups including Operations, Investor Relations, Trading, and Back Office.
Leverage experience with rating agencies’ websites and models to efficiently find and source credit reports, peer analysis and methodologies, and related documents.



 Qualifications
 

Bachelor's degree with a high GPA in finance, math or another quantitative field from a top-rated institution
2+ years of structured credit experience coming from a buyside, sell-side or consulting firm in either a valuations or structuring capacity
Demonstrated quantitative and analytical skills (proficiency in Excel, Intex, etc.)
Meticulous attention to detail coupled with robust project management and organizational abilities
Consistent demonstration of clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Comfort working within a dynamic team and excelling in a fast-paced, evolving environment
Database experience, including proficiency with SQL, R, Python or similar is preferred.

   Why work for us?
  


   A career at Janus Henderson is more than a job, it’s about investing in a brighter future together.
  


   Our Mission at Janus Henderson is to help clients define and achieve superior financial outcomes through differentiated insights, disciplined investments, and world-class service. We will do this by protecting and growing our core business, amplifying our strengths and diversifying where we have the right.
  


   Our Values are key to driving our success, and are at the heart of everything we do:
  

   Clients Come First - Always | Execution Supersedes Intention | Together We Win | Diversity Improves Results | Truth Builds Trust
  

   If our mission, values, and purpose align with your own, we would love to hear from you!
  



   Your opportunity
  


   In this role you will provide support for the portfolio managers and the investment team providing relevant information and recommendations regarding investments across the capital stack in Securitized Products with a focus on ABS including autos, cards, transportation and esoteric ABS. In depth knowledge of these sectors is critical to this position. Focus on making recommendations for profitable trades on a risk-adjusted basis in a Total Rate of Return and High Income environment. Additionally, this position will have opportunities to develop, launch and manage new portfolios with a focus on asset-backed securities in both the public and private markets.
  


Work on Securitized Products specific analyst with a focus on identifying opportunities primarily in ABS but potentially in other areas of Securitized Products as well.
Be responsible for the selection of the best risk-adjusted, total return Securitized securities with a focus on income and capital preservation.
Be responsible for understanding drivers of returns including: carry, duration, volatility, liquidity, optionality and default risk.
Have the ability to manipulate off-the-shelf models to drive cash-flows and risk analysis, including Bloomberg and Intex.
Build, update and maintain relative value models and surveil all models on a monthly basis.
Work with internal risk and analytics team to model, develop and update Securitized portfolio risk measures and visual displays.


Carry out other duties as assigned.




   What to expect when you join our firm
  


Hybrid working and reasonable accommodations
Generous Holiday policies
Paid volunteer time to step away from your desk and into the community
Support to grow through professional development courses, tuition/qualification reimbursement and more
All-inclusive approach to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
Maternal/paternal leave benefits and family services
Complimentary subscription to Headspace – the mindfulness app
Discounted membership to ClassPass and other health and well-being benefits
Unique employee events and programs including a 14er challenge
Complimentary beverages, snacks, and all employee Happy Hours




   Must have skills
  


Bachelor’s degree required.
Strong modeling skills required. Need to be proficient in building and maintaining financial models to forecast future revenue, earnings, and cash flows.
Ability to work and make decisions independently as well as function effectively within a team.
Advanced MS Word, Excel, Bloomberg and internet skills.
Deep understanding of corporate finance, accounting, and fixed income markets.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Ability to multi-task, organize, and assimilate large amounts of information quickly.
Commitment to building the business.




   Nice to have skills
  


Post-graduate degree such as MBA, and CFA and/or CPA helpful
Quant, programming skills and statistics knowledge preferred.
Strong creativity, initiative, and drive.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate articulately, concisely, and persuasively.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build relationships internally and externally.




   Investment areas
  


   Has responsibility for supporting portfolios that are covered by the Fixed Income research team.
  


   Potential for growth
  


Mentoring
Leadership development programs
Regular training
Career development services
Continuing education courses




   You will be expected to understand the regulatory obligations of the firm, and abide by the regulated entity requirements and JHI policies applicable for your role.
  


   At Janus Henderson Investors we’re committed to an inclusive and supportive environment. We believe diversity improves results and we welcome applications from all backgrounds. Don’t worry if you don’t think you tick every box, we still want to hear from you! We understand everyone has different commitments and while we can’t accommodate every flexible working request we’re happy to be asked about work flexibility and our hybrid working environment. If you need any reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process, please get in touch and let us know at recruiter@janushenderson.com.
  


   Compensation information
  


   The base salary range for this position is $175,000-200,000. This range is estimated for this role. Actual pay may be different. This role will remain open through October 18, 2024. Colorado law requires an estimated closing date for job postings. Please don't be discouraged from applying if you see this date has passed.


#LI-LD1, #LI-Hybrid



Annual Bonus Opportunity: Position is eligible to receive an annual discretionary bonus award from the profit pool. The profit pool is funded based on Company profits. Individual bonuses are determined based on Company, department, team and individual performance.
  


Benefits: Janus Henderson is committed to offering a comprehensive total rewards package to eligible employees that includes; competitive compensation, pension/retirement plans, and various health, wellbeing and lifestyle benefits. To learn more about our offerings please visit the Why Join Us section on the career page here.

 Job Title: Data Analyst/Scientist Overview: 
 
  EverWatch is a government solutions company providing advanced defense, intelligence, and deployed support to our country’s most critical missions. We are a full-service government solutions company. Harnessing the most advanced technology and solutions, we strengthen defenses and control environments to preserve continuity and ensure mission success.
 

 EverWatch is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age (40 or older), disability, genetic information, citizenship or immigration status, and veteran status or any other factor prohibited by applicable law.

  EverWatch employees are focused on tackling the most difficult challenges of the US Government. We offer the best salaries and benefits packages in our industry - to identify and retain the top talent in support of our critical mission objectives.
  Responsibilities: 
 
  As a client-facing data analyst on our National Security team, you’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Not only will you provide a deep understanding of their data, you’ll also advise your client on what the information means and how it can be used to make an impact on national defense.
 




 Use your data analytics expertise to support client and stakeholder relationships.
   


    Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through advanced data processing techniques of large data sets.
   


    Contribute to impactful work and guide decision-making across multiple organizations.
   


    Apply innovation and data analytics expertise by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.
   


    Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages and Microsoft Office Suite.
   


    Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.
   


    Apply data visualization through different formats, such as graphs, tables, and PowerPoint slides.
   


    Grow your communication and technical skills by merging consulting and big data to create data-centric solutions across the space intelligence mission.
   
 Qualifications: 
 
  Qualifications:
 



    Experience performing data processing tasks independently
   


    Experience leading and guiding data processing functions and driving innovation in data processing methodologies
   


    Ability to contribute to the advancement of data processing capabilities
   


    Ability to interpret and communicate strategic guidance to the team
   


    TS/SCI clearance with a polygraph
   


    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Intelligence Studies and 10+ years of experience performing data analysis tasks and providing leadership guidance to teams, or 12+ years of experience performing data analysis tasks and providing leadership guidance to teams in lieu of degree
   


  Nice to have:
 


Prior experience working with military personnel at Buckley Space Force Base
Familiarization with ELINT databases within the Intelligence Community
Strong ability to perform functions within the Microsoft suite of programs

Description and Requirements 








Who We Are


        Enel is a globally recognized leader in sustainable energy and is consistently named one of Fortune Magazine’s “Companies that are Changing the World.” It is also one of the largest and most trusted energy companies in the world, serving around 70 million customers in more than 30 countries across 5 continents. The Enel Group vision is about Open Power. Open Power means opening energy access to more people; opening the world of energy to new technologies; opening new ways for people to manage energy; opening new uses of energy; and opening more partnerships. These are ambitious goals, and we are pursuing them with the passion of more than 65,000 people whose brilliant work is based on our values of Responsibility, Innovation, Trust and Proactivity. At Enel North America, our businesses are leading the energy transition, creating the sustainable energy solutions of the future to help individuals, businesses and communities change energy into lasting value.
       


 The Opportunity:


        Enel Green Power Operations & Maintenance has a need for a Senior Data Analyst to join our OMI group (Operations & Maintenance Improvement). The role directly supports the data management, analytics, and integrations within core business systems for GPG North America. The main responsibility of this position is to provide support and expertise to strategically improve and maintain operational data, while further expanding the data capabilities of our current application stack and researching integrations with emerging technologies that we adopt.
       

        As a Senior Data Analyst, you will demonstrate responsibility, innovation, proactivity, and a willingness to lead projects when necessary. The ideal applicant possesses great communication skills as they will be interfacing with different groups to understand business needs and implement solutions to current and upcoming data challenges. You will be the main support in troubleshooting and resolving data issues between core systems, supporting development and implementation of new data connections, and documentation of said processes. A secondary component of the role will be to identify, plan, and implement new areas for data automation. Your core responsibilities will require you to find ways to capitalize on existing data streams to increase accessibility and business value, while collaborating and supporting both local and global groups with new initiatives. You will also be responsible for creating documentation to support created processes, as well as be a resource for any future data integrations and investments the team should be making to keep in line with and move toward the company mission and vision.
       


 What You'll Do at Enel North America:


        Responsibilities, include, but not limited to:
       


Configuration and maintenance of data systems with a heavy focus on the AVEVA/OSIsoft PI platform.
Support the creation and maintenance of ETL processes within data tools, including but not limited to Python, Apache Airflow, SAS, and SQL (MS SQL & PSQL).
Development of data processes and analytics to support O&M needs.
Interface with other groups to understand current data needs and challenges
Identify opportunities for improvement with data processing and automation task and tools




 Who You Are:



Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Strong analytical skills.
Strong verbal and communication skills.
Strong motivation and a drive to learn.




 What You've Accomplished:


        Must have:
       


Bachelor's (Master's is a plus) from an accredited college or university in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, mathematics, operations research, engineering, data science or computer science).
Minimum of 3-5 years of working with databases, administrative or end user.
Experience in PI Suite and/or other real-time data systems.
Experience in developing or administering AVEVA/OSIsoft PI platform, PI Asset Framework, and PI Web API, preferably within the power/utility industry.
Strong experience with data analytics and data management.




 Preferred:
       


Experience with data visualization tools such as SAS Viya, Tableau or Power BI
Intermediate knowledge of coding languages, preferably python or java.




 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion:


        Enel North America is dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information. We will not discriminate, in any employment decision, against any individual or group on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information, or veterans/national guard/military reserve status. This shall be done in compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws in every location in which Enel North America has facilities. Enel North America maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks, where permitted by law. Accessibility – If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions please contact EnelApplication@enel.com.
       


 What Enel North America Offers You:



Enel North America offers its regular full-time employees affordable, quality healthcare for you and your family, life insurance and disability benefits to provide security, and retirement benefits to help you plan for your financial future. In addition, we offer an array of other benefits such as flexible spending accounts, tuition reimbursement and professional development allowance.

Some additional perks to working with Enel North America include:

Profile insightsFind out how your skills align with the job descriptionSkillsDo you have experience in Visual Studio?YesNoEducationDo you have a Bachelor's degree?YesNo Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your profile.Pay$75,000 a yearJob typeFull-time BenefitsPulled from the full job descriptionOn-the-job training Full job description

  Location:
  4910 Tiedeman Road - Brooklyn, Ohio 44144
 

  2025 Key’s Technology, Operations & Services Rotational Analyst Program (Data & Analytics Track)- Cleveland
 


  Program Start: July 14th, 2025
 


  What does our Enterprise Analyst Program offer?
 


  KeyBank’s Enterprise Analyst Program is a training program that facilitates the transition from college to a full-time career at Key. The program provides opportunities to learn about Key’s business and strategic pillars, learn about Key’s industry-leading employee benefits, engage in exciting networking events with Analysts across various teams, hear from members of the Executive Leadership Team, and receive relevant training ahead of starting rotations.
 

  At the conclusion of the training program, Analysts will begin a rotational program. Continued development includes on-the-job training, networking across various levels of the organization, and rotation placements and mentorships that will provide an environment for shared learning and advice, encourage professional development, and assist in the development of career aspirations and goals.
 

  Key Technology, Operations and Services Overview
 


  Key Technology, Operations & Services (KTOS) brings the future of banking to life. KeyBank is equal parts financial institution and technology innovator, and the KTOS team is at the center of creating solutions to solve the vital needs of our clients first.
 


  KTOS – made up of more than 5,000 talented teammates – enables the technology needs of business partners and clients across the enterprise. Through efficient, reliable, and secure technology, KTOS delivers a competitive distinction through innovation and collaboration.
 


  KTOS plays a significant role in Key’s ability to build enduring client relationships through innovative solutions & extraordinary service. KTOS is accountable for a variety of critical functions that are the foundation for Key’s day-to-day operations:
 

Business Delivery, providing comprehensive technology solutions to Key’s lines of business & functional areas
Enterprise Technology including architecture, infrastructure, networks, data centers and cloud technology to ensure stable systems and platforms
Enterprise Data and Analytics Services, enabling transformation of customer and market data into valuable insights and analytics
Enterprise Operations, spanning Origination through Default Management, Deposit Operations, ACH, Wire & Check Payment Operations, and Treasury Operations
Enterprise Security Services, including Tech Risk Management, Vulnerability Management, Information Security, Cybersecurity, Fraud Detection/Management, Identity Verification, BSA/AML Operations and Physical Security


  About Key’s Technology, Operations & Services Rotational Analyst Program
 


  The KeyBank Technology, Operations & Services Rotational Analyst Program will begin with a 2-week orientation that will include skill training in soft skills, technical business software, and line of business specific acumen.
 


  The KTOS analyst program is 12-18 months in duration consisting of 2-3 six-month rotations. Each analyst will receive on-the-job training in each rotation. Placement after rotations will be determined based on the strengths and interest of the individual and business need.
 


 Data & Analytics Operations Track: KTOS Operations teams deliver world-class operations analysis, solutions, and continual process improvements while supporting multiple lines of business. Rotational Analysts on the Operations Track have the following opportunities:


Work alongside industry experts and professionals on critical “real world” projects
Exposure to KeyBank and Key Technology, Operations & Services
Grow your professional network as you move through the program
On-the-job training and opportunities to use and grow skills in industry leading software, including: Excel and PowerPoint, Office 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, VBA, Tableau, ServiceNow, Visual Studio, Jira, Automation Anywhere, Jenkins, Nucleus, PowerShell, HTML, C#, Python, SQL



  Opportunities for placement after the program (vary depending on business need):
 

Business Risks and Controls
Business Optimization and Analysis
Commercial Servicing & Operations
Continuous Improvement
Cyber and Physical Project Office
Payment Processing Operations
Reporting and Analytics
Workforce Management



  Job Responsibilities (Varies depending on rotation assignment):
 

Attend and contribute to all relevant meetings
Business, Operations, and Process Analysis
Data Analytics and Reporting
Grow proficiency in relevant software and systems
Learn the structure and operations of the business
Presenting Report Data and Insights
Project Management



  Qualifications
 

Graduating with a four-year degree or graduate level degree by May 2025 with focused coursework in Business, Operations, Data Science, System Administration, Industrial Engineering, Statistics/ Mathematics, or related majors
Outstanding academic achievement (minimum 3.0 GPA)
Demonstrated leadership, learning ability, and teamwork from past work experience and/or extracurricular activities
Ability to adapt to dynamic and changing priorities and responsibilities
Bring solid analytical, problem solving, communication and presentation skills
Proficiency in MS Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Possess intellectual curiosity, enthusiasm and willingness to learn



  Compensation and Benefits
 

  This position has a salary of $75,000.00. Compensation also includes a $5,000.00 Sign-on Bonus.
 


 KeyBank’s Campus Program Internship and Analyst positions are not eligible for employment visa sponsorship (e.g., H-1B visa). This includes, for example, situations where a candidate may have temporary work authorization while enrolled in school or upon graduation (e.g., CPT, OPT) but would need H-1B visa sponsorship within a few years of employment in order to maintain employment eligibility.

This ERP Business Analyst will conduct constant analysis of existing business process configuration within Microsoft Dynamics F&O, and partner with production locations on improvements & changes. Since this role is the point of contact for all requests and changes to the production environment including technical errors and enhancement requests, the role requires understanding of all aspects of Microsoft Dynamics F&O from customer service to Manufacturing, through supply chain and to financial reconciliation. Key qualities for this position include strong communication skills, teamwork and partnership capabilities, business process knowledge & improvement methods, self-motivation and critical thinking.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities

Primary point of contact for operations errors & troubleshooting technical issues raised by the plants. Work directly with our partner of record to resolve major production issues that occur.

Partner with plant Continuous Improvement teams on suggesting and implementing process improvements.
Lead & perform training to existing users as new functionality is introduced.
Perform regular check points with all plants to receive input on status and confirm appropriate process is being followed.
Perform all system validation during Microsoft programed upgrades.

Experience and Education 

Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business or technical field.
3+ years of ERP experience in a manufacturing environment.
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics F&O or Dynamics AX is preferred.
Strong understanding of ERP Finance & Operations processes.
Ability to effectively communicate with a variety of stakeholders and end users with an adaptive style, influencing skill and change management orientation.
Strong tactical, problem solving and executional skills and project management experience.
Advance technical skill with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.

 Overview: 
 
  You have a passion for finding trends and providing solutions that drive profitable growth and maximize returns. As our Marketing Data Analst you’ll apply your unique blend of keen business knowledge and solid technical skills to help optimize inquiry acquisition and conversion performance.
 

 Now you can turn your passion for statistical data analysis to help our team change lives through data driven campaigns. As our Marketing Data Analyst you’ll evaluate marketing data, identify gaps and present opportunities to improve digital, search, email and engagement channels across campaigns for its 17 campuses.
 

 If you want to impact our goals on a daily basis and the lives we touch, we would like to make you part of our team.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Analyze data, identify trends and audit processes as they relate to marketing campaigns, revenue, click and conversion rates, ROI and ad spend.
Develop and report both scheduled and ad-hoc analysis of new and existing campaigns.
Improve department reporting procedures, accuracy through automation, and query optimization, as well as manage data integrity.
Engage with internal resource teams and experts, as well as vendors to monitor and assess conversion, spend, ROI, etc.
Identify gaps and opportunities to improve efficiencies, acquisition and conversion performance.
Research market and competitive landscape in support of program/ product development and rollout.
Provide internal customers and executive management with thoughtful insights into customer trends and marketing campaign performance.
Explain complex topics through clear and concise oral and written communication
 Qualifications: 
 
3-5 years of data analytics experience, preferably in marketing and digital marketing
3+ years’ experience using data to develop and measure content and inquiry/conversion marketing effectiveness
Experience analyzing and tracking multiple data points across platforms and sources, while coming to actionable conclusions based upon the data
Ability to apply context and student/customer lifecycle behavior as part of data interpretation
Experience setting up and implementing A/B testing
Experience with SQL, Excel and BI360
Experience with CRMs is a plus
Familiar with Paid (SEM) and Organic (SEO) marketing concepts
Experience with Google Analytics, Adwords, Google360 and TagManage is preferred
Experience with email marketing is a plus
Demonstrated ability to think strategically and use data to recommend actions.
Proven ability to build relationships and operate effectively within a team.
Experience in higher education, insurance or financial services marketing is preferred.
Bachelor’s degree required.


 Compensation for this position is between $65-75K annually.

Inventory Analyst
Job Description

 ABOUT THE COMPANY
Crecera Brands is the driving force behind Sportsman’s Guide, The Golf Warehouse, and Baseball Savings.com, three of America’s leading retailers of outdoor gear, sporting goods, and golf supplies. For nearly 45 years, our companies have been dedicated to helping our customers enjoy the fun, freedom, and traditions of the great outdoors. From hunting and fishing to playing ball and hitting the links, the companies of Crecera Brands deliver the gear you need to succeed. Our websites include sportsmansguide.com, tgw.com, and baseballsavings.com.

 ABOUT THE POSITION
Inventory Analysts are responsible for developing and managing product forecasts and inventory within the assigned categories for catalog, web and marketplace channels using demand planning and inventory optimization software. Generate accurate item level demand forecasts using historical sales data and market intelligence, while accounting for promotional lifts and price elasticity. This position is responsible for driving continuous improvement of the demand planning process, increasing organizational capability, and providing business strategy and recommendations based on in-depth knowledge of our sales data and forecasts. The Inventory Analyst will be the central hub for all forecasting and planning information and will communicate effectively across the organization.

 RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

Manage the overall forecasting and planning activities for the assigned categories.
Work with Merchandising team to create new and repeat product forecasts for catalog, ecommerce and marketplace channels.
Manage demand and inventory planning from initial launch through the entire product lifecycle
Collaborate with merchant partners on Open to Buy (OTB) strategy, own receipt planning and manage to EOH budget.
Configure forecasting and planning systems to achieve the desired forecast accuracy, service levels and planning efficiencies.
Perform regular analysis on actual sales vs forecasted demand to ensure constant improvement in all aspects of the forecasting and inventory planning processes.
Create purchase orders and vendor forecasts to optimize inventory turns.
Establish a professional working relationship with vendors/suppliers with clear expectations and frequent follow up.
Ensure Key Performance Indicators and goals are being met (forecast accuracy, Core sku In Stock, inventory turns, fill rate, aged inventory level, seasonal carry-over, open-to-buy).
Utilize business intelligence tools to optimize service levels and inventory position.
Continuously look for opportunities to improve the demand planning process, dissect forecast errors and rectify as needed to meet established forecasting accuracy goals.
Perform ERP system maintenance (updating ship/expected dates, discontinued codes, inventory disposition, etc.)
Other duties as assigned.


 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Business, Operations Management or Supply Chain Management or equivalent education and experience.
2+ years’ experience in forecasting and demand planning.
Excellent written communication skills with ability to write in a clear and concise business manner.
Ability to speak in front of various sized groups and levels within the company to present ideas and explain data.
Requires solid business and financial acumen and strong analytical background.
Enthusiastic, self driven with positive, proactive attitude.
Must possess critical thinking skills to analyze data, make decisions and develop action plans.
High ethical standards.
Strong organizational skills.
Team oriented and experience working in cross functional teams.
Ability to work effectively in a fast paced environment.
Ability to develop strong relationships internally and externally.
Ability to apply experience and knowledge to provide creative solutions to problems.
Experience using information systems associated with forecasting and demand planning.
Significant experience using Microsoft Excel; proficiency with functions such as filters, sorting, formulas, pivot tables, vlookup, etc.


 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)
