Blueair, as part of Unilever, is a rapidly growing global brand with rocketlike potential. At Blueair we believe that the freedom to breathe clean air is a basic right, and we fight for that right around the world. We have built a team of thinkers, dreamers, and doers who are passionate about our impactful products. At Blueair, we strive to gain and support the next generation of innovators in the market. We are seeking to add to our entrepreneurial culture and team with an eCommerce Data Analyst.

 Position Description:
The eCommerce Data Analyst at Blueair will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive business decisions. This position involves maintaining a single source of truth by integrating data from various sources, creating executive dashboards, and presenting findings to business leaders and the C-suite. The analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams to share insights and support strategic initiatives, while also owning the Business Analytics data ecosystem to ensure a robust data foundation.

This role is hybrid and requires applicants to live in the following states: IL, IN, NY, NJ and be willing to commute to a local office (Chicago/NYC) two days a week. 

Responsibilities and Functions:

Data Management: Maintain a single source of truth for data by integrating information from multiple sources, ensuring accuracy and accessibility.
Dashboard Creation: Design and develop executive dashboards to provide actionable insights to business leaders and stakeholders.
Reporting & Stakeholder Engagement: Maintain various data reports and conduct regular meetings with stakeholders to review data trends, propose actions, and drive decision-making.
Presentation Skills: Frequently present data findings to business leads and the executive team, translating complex data into clear, recommended actions.
Data Ecosystem Ownership: Own and enhance the Business Analytics (BA) data ecosystem, maintaining existing frameworks and driving the vision for a robust data foundation within Blueair.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional partners including brand, product development, operations, and finance to share insights and support their business decisions.


 Skills & Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in marketing, analytics, business or a related field.
Proficiency in data analytics tools such as Domo, Power BI, NetSuite, and Google Analytics 4 (GA4).
Strong presentation skills with the ability to communicate effectively to business leaders and C-suite executives.
Proven ability to turn complex data sets into actionable insights and recommendations.
Comfortable managing large sets of intricate data and deriving meaningful conclusions.
Industry Experience: Previous experience in eCommerce in the durable consumer products sector is a major plus.



About the Company:
We are looking to add to our entrepreneurial culture and team. Here, employees are challenged to perform at a high level while helping the company grow and are given the opportunity to excel and grow themselves. Blueair is constantly in pursuit of opportunities that strengthen our cause to support and enhance the education and betterment of air quality for people around the world.

 Our Take on Leadership:
 Growth Mindset: This is competitive leadership. Taking the lead in the marketplace versus following. It's a positive attitude about the company's future — glass half-full —but it's realistic. It's passion for winning. Winning defined as gaining market share. It's placing a fresh emphasis on innovation — challenging the status quo.
 Consumer and Customer Focus: This is purpose-driven leadership. It's externally focused — on consumers, on customers. First take care of consumers and customers; financial performance will follow. It's a heightened passion for the consumer: “I firmly believe in improving the lives of consumers.” It's bringing the voice of the consumer and the customer into everything we do. It's seeing our brands through their eyes.
 Bias for action: This is action-driven leadership: "This is what I will do." It's speed and sense of urgency in making decisions. But it needs to be thoughtful action, intelligent risk-taking. Also, it's not wasting time on bureaucracy — it’s output that counts. And it’s simplifying my agenda, carefully choosing priorities — and not taking on too much.
 Accountability and Responsibility: This is performance-driven leadership. "I will deliver against KPIs, holding myself to the highest standards.” I will also hold other people accountable — first by setting clear expectations and then by telling them if they are on the right path. It's staring reality in the eye — doing it with numbers. It's taking responsibility for Blueair's overall performance, not just by delivering my results but by helping other people deliver their results. Finally, it’s personally driving change and using operational discipline to deliver on the promise.
 Building Talent and Teams: This is people-driven leadership. It's passion for people. It's having the best people in the right positions, whatever the person's gender or background. It's giving people plenty of room to do their part and recognizing them for their contributions. It's investing in people's development — giving them feedback and challenging work. It’s also constantly challenging myself to grow and improve. And it's building aligned, cohesive teams that pull together to win.

 If you consider yourself a go-getter who loves to #win, and someone who loves to have fun, then we may have the job for you.

 Blueair is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled, or veteran status.

Dominion Energy is committed to providing reliable, affordable, and increasingly clean energy that powers our customers every day. If you want to work for a purpose-driven company that values safety and collaboration, we’re looking for you. You won’t just find a job here; you’ll find your career. Military service members and veterans with ranks from E3-E5, W1-W2, or O1-O3, plus appropriate equivalent combination of education and years of experience as outlined below will be considered for this opportunity.




Job Summary


The GIS Development and Data Analyst is responsible for the direct development of GIS-related software applications and for providing complex analytics on modeled GIS data. With full proficiency, the Analyst makes recommendations and advises clients on the use of GIS and other geospatial technologies. Uses skilled expertise and programming-level proficiency with related software to develop, collect, store and analyze the GIS data. The GIS Development and Data Analyst is approached when clients want to upgrade or create new GIS-related applications or present geospatial data in a way that is easier to understand. Also responsible for using data to create maps and graphs, conducting research into specific fields, and sourcing and compiling data from a wide range of sources such as satellite images, existing maps, and field observation. Position's expertise may be called upon for a wide variety of projects, and can be engaged by a range of clients, including information technology (IT) management, architects and analysts. May also be engaged by a business unit group to support GIS concerns relating to a specific project.

Other Duties:

Front level response for emergency or high priority programming or data forensic analysis
Provides full support in developing and maintaining the GIS computing infrastructure
Assumes business representative role in the development and maintenance of GIS-related projects to Information Technology (IT) groups
Recommends and establishes standards and procedures to deal with production of high-priority GIS data, maps and associated services
Actively participates in the design and development of enterprise geographic information systems which may link facility maps with data to produce maps, web apps and data analytics
Writes programs and develops user interfaces, menus and macro-level commands to meet high priority GIS staff needs
Researches, develops, and recommends technology, price, schedule and other elements to meet a specific customer need relating to geospatial and attribution data
Creates GIS tools, products, and software integration to meet a variety of business client needs
Trains users and programmers to ensure maintenance, usage and application are appropriate
Works with clients to determine GIS needs and architectural considerations, then agree upon a scope of work
Documents research and development work while providing timely reporting of project status





Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities & Experience



3+ years of directly related experience with developing and analyzing GIS data
Knowledge of the GIS applications and associated database
Applied knowledge of ArcGIS/ArcFM Desktop, ArcGIS Server
Applied knowledge of programming languages (including VB, C, Python, JavaScript), APIs/SDKs for those languages (including ArcObjects for .Net, ArcPy, ArcGIS API for JavaScript, jQuery, Dojo Toolkit), SQL (specifically PLSQL as our Enterprise Geo-Database is Oracle), Basic RDBMS Concepts (tables, views, indexes, transactions, queries, procedures, functions, etc.), ArcSDE, ArcSDE Versioned Database Environment, Geospatial Analysis, ESRI Model Builder
Applied knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Access, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)
Knowledge of general Information Systems concepts
Basic understanding of AutoCAD
Knowledge of Geographic Positioning Systems
Understanding of functional business processes and business data attribution
Ability to quickly learn other business units' processes and to learn new technologies
Excellent writing and interpersonal skills
Ability to work well with other business units
Ability to address multiple tasks simultaneously
Experience with Esri or other applicable GIS systems.





Education Requirements


Bachelor's Degree or an equivalent combination of education and demonstrated related experience may be accepted in lieu of preferred level of education.

Preferred Disciplines: Geography, Geographical Technology ,Information Systems
Other disciplines may be substituted for the preferred disciplines(s) listed above.

About the Role & Team:

“We make magic.” That’s our motto at Walt Disney Parks and Resorts. And it permeates everything we do. At Disney, we help inspire that magic by enabling our teams to push the limits of entertainment and create the never-before-seen!
The Consumer Insights, Measurement, and Analytics organization informs strategy development through actionable data analytics, integration and insights. We provide consumer centric solutions through deep understanding of all relevant audiences.

Our Consumer Insight team identifies demand drivers and revenue opportunities; explores consumer needs with essential segments to inform long-term strategies; tests our advertising along the entire creative development journey; and maximizes the guest experience across both parks, hotels and Downtown Disney to build long-term loyalty.

Integration and interpretation of data, mining and synthesis, and compelling communication skills are crucial to work with partners to tackle our challenges. Our team prioritizes multiple assignments at once, across varied partner groups and complex businesses.

This role will support the areas of Creative Development testing, the Magic Key business, and the Customer Experience, reporting to the Sr. Manager, Consumer Insight.

 What You Will Do:

Demonstrate curiosity – Proactively gather a holistic understanding of the strategic context to inform a more impactful solution.
Put Skills to the Test - Mine and analyze data to test hypotheses and answer business questions. Interpret information to provide objective, clear and actionable insight.
Exercise leadership - Support consumer insight projects across all phases of the research process including needs identification, methodology design, survey design, cross-functional management, data mining, and presentation of results, using the proper techniques along the way that provide essential insights and actionable results that address the business opportunities.
Team up with partners - Foster relationships with internal partners and external vendors, managing specific work-streams.
Tell the story - Communicate findings in a compelling way.


 Required Qualifications & Skills:

Three+ years of proven experience in a related field (e.g. marketing/sales, market research, business analytics, strategic planning, new product development, etc.)
Ability to project manage
Professional experience in quantitative, qualitative research and statistical techniques
Proficiency in Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets) or Sheets and presentation software such as PowerPoint or Keynote
Strong attention to detail while keeping business goals in mind
Proven ability to partner and work well with multiple levels of the organization


 Preferred Qualifications:

Hands-on experience with SPSS or similar package


 Education:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent – relevant areas include Behavioral Economics, Psychology, Sociology, Cultural Anthropology, Business Economics, Cognitive Science, Neuropsychology, etc.

 The hiring range for this position in California is $84,500 to $113,300 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

The USC Keck School of Medicine - Alzheimer Therapeutic Research Institute (ATRI), located in San Diego, California is an academic institute comprised of an expert panel of scientific collaborators committed to advancing the development of new treatments for Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) through innovative clinical trials.

Participate with principal investigator in the preparation of the administrative components of proposals within parameters of sponsored and non-sponsored research guidelines. Oversee and communicate submission process, both paper and electronic. Reviews documents for completeness and compliance.

 Overview: 
 
  Our team members are the heart of what makes us better.
 




  At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community.
 




  Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.
 


 The Clinical Data Analyst is responsible for providing support of the collection, organization and integrity of clinical data required for clinical quality measure reporting and/or clinical service registry reporting. This position works closely and serves as the link between clinical quality measures and public reporting objectives and the core technological capabilities the Digital Technology Services (DTS) Team is building across the Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH) network. Responsible for assisting DTS on tool development required for clinical quality measure monitoring and reporting internal and external to HMH.
  Responsibilities: 
 
  A day in the life of a Clinical Data Analyst at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:
 

Provides measure expertise and business insights to DTS for data analytics tool development and reporting to ensure measurement methodologies and data dictionaries are reflected accurately.
Responsible for the maintenance of the clinical catalog that provides measure details; rules, criteria, definitions, validation, ways that analytics tools can reference/lookup measures (regulatory measures as well as internal measures).
Maintains clinical quality measurement knowledge through self-development and keeps current on all specification changes relevant to assigned project(s).
Collaborate with DTS ensuring Epic data collection and outside data abstraction efforts align in the data warehouse.
Support DTS by providing quality assurance for analytics tools utilizing quality measures.
Ensures the integrity and accuracy of information extracted or collected and entered into the data collection system.
Assesses potential problems affecting the data collection process and coordinates follow-up of problem resolution with the team and/or manager.
Learns and understands the varied databases and project related terminology. Participates on all educational sessions and/or webinars.
Performs data submissions to CMS and TJC.
Facilitates and collaborates with DTS for data uploads specific to regulatory submission data.
Responsible for access requests to Epic and/or third-party applications for vendor abstractors.
Keep continuous up to date knowledge of regulatory measures such as core measure, eCQM and claim measures as directed by leadership.
Processes access requests to Epic and/or third-party applications for vendor abstractors.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
 Qualifications: 
 
 Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
 

Minimum of 2 years of experience in healthcare.
Bachelor's degree in healthcare field or professional degree.
Proficient skills in analytical methodologies, understanding of databases, and/or spreadsheet, technical writing, quantitative analysis and/or use of statistical principles.
Proficiency in the use of computer applications and software for communication (e-mail, scheduling, and remote conferencing), word processing, spreadsheet function, and presentation preparation.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to present to various levels within the organization.
Comprehensive knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology.
Experience or knowledge of ICD-10 coding.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with demonstrated ability to work well with all levels of staff.
Strong critical thinking skills with ability to handle changing work environments and prioritize activities based on department needs.
Detail-oriented and meets quality and productivity standards.
Ability and willingness to be cross-trained and become proficient in multiple clinical domains.
Proficient computer skills that may include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms.





Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
 

Experience working with Epic.
Understanding of national quality performance measurement and reporting, particularly those identified by the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), the State of New Jersey Department of Health, and the Joint Commission.
Proficiency in Google applications.





Licenses and Certifications Preferred:
 

National Patient Safety Foundation (NPSF) Certified Professional in Patient Safety (CPPS) certification within three years of hire.

Join the Cleveland Clinic team, where you will work alongside passionate caregivers and provide patient-first healthcare. Cleveland Clinic is recognized as one of the top hospitals in the nation. At Cleveland Clinic, you will work alongside dedicated caregivers, receive endless support and appreciation, and build a rewarding career with one of the most respected healthcare organizations in the world.  The Market Intelligence Analyst, will assists in the commercialization of a large portfolio of inventions by supporting market intelligence activities focused on assessing the viability of new medical technologies as part of a cross functional team. The primary focus of this position will be on biopharma therapeutics and diagnostic technologies.

The ideal caregiver is someone who:

Has three years of experience in one or more of the following areas: healthcare market research, financial analysis, business modeling, or technology commercialization. OR Advanced degree may offset up to 2 years' experience.
Demonstrates understanding of medical technology and healthcare industry market trends and regulations.
Is comfortable working with large data sets (e.g. Excel).


 This is a rewarding opportunity that offers growth-oriented projects, mentorship, support, and resources. You will experience great exposure to both the institute and department leadership and have numerous opportunities for career growth.



 At Cleveland Clinic, we know what matters most. That's why we treat our caregivers as if they are our own family, and we are always creating ways to be there for you. Here, you'll find that we offer: resources to learn and grow, a fulfilling career for everyone, and comprehensive benefits that invest in your health, your physical and mental well-being and your future. When you join Cleveland Clinic, you'll be part of a supportive caregiver family that will be united in shared values and purpose to fulfill our promise of being the best place to receive care and the best place to work in healthcare.  Responsibilities:


Assists in the commercialization of a large portfolio of inventions by supporting market intelligence activities focused on assessing the viability of new medical technologies.
Conducts market research studies to provide timely and accurate information in the assessment of business opportunities across a large portfolio of intellectual property.
Collects, compiles and analyzes data from primary and secondary sources to construct procedure and product sales models, target market profiles, demographic and epidemiological models, competitive technology profiles, pricing and reimbursement analyses, and investment benchmark analyses.
Conducts prior art searches and patentability assessments.
Prepares reports, presentations and informational briefs to communicate market research findings and recommendations to internal and external clients.
Participates in strategic planning efforts and supports operational decision marking for portfolio technologies and companies.
Other duties as assigned.

Requires the ability to walk to various locations to attend meetings.

Follows standard precautions using personal protective equipment as required.

  There is a place for you at T. Rowe Price to grow, contribute, learn, and make a difference. We are a premier asset manager focused on delivering global investment management excellence and retirement services that investors can rely on today and in the future. The work we do matters. We invite you to explore the opportunity to join us and grow your career with us.
 


  About This Position
 

  The Sales Intelligence & Insights team seeks a creative problem-solver passionate about crafting insightful visualizations. We value independent decision-making and limitless curiosity. Our team culture strikes a balance between autonomy and collaboration, enabling us to provide rapid, unscheduled production support while also advancing larger, more complex projects. As part of an industry-leading revenue enablement group, our team equips sellers with the compelling insights they need to excel in their roles through high-impact, intelligent actions.
 


  On a day-to-day basis, the Senior Analyst, Data Analytics will join disparate data sources, perform analysis, build and maintain dashboards that visualize complex data to deliver valuable insights that drive business decisions. In this role you will also perform data reviews, report updates, basic quantitative analysis, quality assurance, and project document editing. Much of your work will be done by manipulating data sets in Alteryx and Excel, conducting exploratory analysis in Salesforce or external data portals, and delivering results through user-friendly Tableau dashboards. A great fit for this role can communicate and collaborate across many different teams, has a knack for troubleshooting, and familiarity with data structure, relational and non-relational databases, and data optimization techniques.
 

  Prior experience in the financial sector is beneficial but not required: we will teach you the key concepts of asset management and sales enablement.
 


  Role Summary
 

  Conducts moderately complex analyses and evaluates data and reporting to deliver functional analytics or business insights. Develops advanced data visualizations to assist business stakeholders.
 


  Responsibilities:
 



    Independently supports assigned area with advanced, complex statistical and quantitative analyses. In partnership with business subject matter experts, leads development of statistical modeling and quantitative analysis projects. Serves as a resource to less experienced team members in development of methodologies and techniques.
   


    Validates and reviews results to ensure they address identified business needs.
   


    Prepares visualizations and delivers results to management and/or other leaders. In partnership with business subject matter experts, provides recommendations for addressing observed outcomes. Translates complex technical concepts and analyses to nontechnical audiences.
   


    Leads cross-functional groups to define requirements. Oversees internal and external business partners in the execution of the plan. Stays abreast of changes in the market to identify opportunities for improved analytical capabilities and methods. Drafts project plans, use cases, user stories, or business cases.
   



  Qualifications:
 

  Required:
 



    Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience AND
   


    5+ years of total relevant work experience
   



  FINRA Requirements
 

  FINRA licenses are not required and will not be supported for this role.
 


  Work Flexibility
 

  This role is eligible for hybrid work, with up to two days per week from home.
 


  Base salary ranges:
  $114,500.00 - $195,000.00 for the location of: California, New York $100,500.00 - $171,500.00 for the location of: Washington, D.C $91,500.00 - $156,500.00 for the location of: Colorado, Maryland, Washington and All other US locations
 

  Placement within the range provided above is based on the individual’s relevant experience and skills for the role. Base salary is only one component of our total compensation package. Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus, which is determined upon company and individual performance.
 


  This job posting is expected to be available until:
  11/30/2024
 

  Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
 

  We strive for equity, equality, and opportunity for all associates. When we embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work, our firm is stronger, and we create greater value for our clients. Our commitment and inclusive programming aim to lift the experience for each associate and builds allies for our global associate community. We know that a sense of belonging is key not only to your success at the firm, but also to your ability to bring your best each day.

Competitive pay and bonuses as well as a generous retirement plan and employee stock purchase plan with matching contributions
Flexible work opportunities
Health care benefits (medical, dental, vision)

Wellness programs (fitness reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program)

Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your profile.Job typeFull-timeShift and scheduleMonday to Friday BenefitsPulled from the full job description401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurance Full job descriptionSummary:
Analyst shall manage the day-to-day activities involving the establishment, management, and oversight of electricity accounts for the company. The responsibilities of this position shall include developing and maintaining contacts with utilities for setting-up, reviewing and disconnecting utility services with a focus on electricity. Incumbent must be knowledgeable of ERCOT connection data protocols. This position shall oversee and coordinate all third-party support services and organizations used to supply detailed and specialty utility services to the company. On an as-needed basis the incumbent shall provide electricity usage and cost analysis to management and trouble-shoot specific account errors. This position will support invoice payment activities including preparation, verification, and submission for payment. The Analyst will report to the office (full- time) 5 days a week.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Manage and coordinate utility service connections with utility companies, including IOUs, cooperatives, and municipalities.
Develop, modify, and maintain company data request forms.
Ensure compliance and accuracy of account data necessary for the establishment of new service locations, review data forms for accuracy and completeness.
Engage utilities for proper account set-up. Confirm required field activities and set-up schedules.
Prepare payment documents for project required CIAC payments.
Manage CIAC payment process including securing proper approvals and account coding.
Create and manage company utility database Site Numbers for all utility services including electric, water, gas, and waste services.
Acquire ESI ID numbers for new meters in the deregulated electricity areas.
Submit all move-ins, switches, and move-outs to third-party service provider for all electricity meters in deregulated electricity service territories.
Migrate new assets into ETP business structure.
Maintain contact utility companies regarding outages or construction repairs to existing service and communication with appropriate operations personnel.
Prepare cost and usage reports monthly for budgeting for management.
Utilize software platform to prepare utility invoices for review and payment and secure requisite approvals as needed.
Acquire 911 addresses for new meters as needed.
Prepare monthly invoices for payment for third-party services.
Download invoice, GL file, Consolidation Detail & Invoice Detail for each ETP client set up with third-party bill processor.
Validate consolidation entries for data and account accuracy.
Obtain approvals and execute consolidated bill payments.
Download billing detail report from third-party portal website and prepare documents for proper backup documentation.
Prepare, secure requisite approvals, and pay monthly multiple ERCOT and TDSP invoices.
Coordinate information flow with Treasury and Accounting.
Daily Day Ahead Invoices (DAM)- for CRRAH and QSE.
Daily Download of DAM Settlement Statements for CRRAH and QSE as back up for DAM Invoices.
Daily download of RTM Initial, Final, True-up and possible re-settlement Statements as back up for RTM invoices.
Interface with operations and engineering on each utility account set up after each acquisition.
Verify all address, meter, utility, and account information for accuracy.
Confirm account information upload into third-party systems.
Establish Site Number creation logic scheme for all utility services.
Preparation and provide employee training on utility systems and set-up protocols and procedures.
Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Experience in the utility industry in account set-ups, billing error corrections, and disconnection preferred.
Working with ERCOT either directly or through a specialized third-party regarding account establishment and management.
Working knowledge of cooperatives, municipalities, regulated and unregulated electric utilities and the unique attributes and constraints of each.
Knowledge of accounting and treasury functions and information requirements.
Develop data templates in spreadsheets and databases.
Strong Communication Skills – Written and Verbal required as need to communicate both internally and externally with ROW Agents, Project Managers, Utility Representatives, etc.
Ability to work with a team in a high-paced environment.
Ability to prioritize one’s workload and being able to work cross-functionally.
Oil and Gas experience and/or contract management experience are preferred.
Software Knowledge:
Excel
Word
Power Point
Outlook
SAP
ENGIE
Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:
The Associate Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 0-2 years of relevant job related experience.
The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 2-5 years of relevant job related experience.
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 5-8 years of relevant job related experience.
Working Conditions:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
Usually, normal office working conditions.
Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time due to prolonged periods of sitting or standing.
Lifting up to 50 lbs. occasionally.
Occasional overnight travel may be required.
Occasional visits to industrial/manufacturing settings, which may include exposure to various materials and chemicals, as well as extreme temperature conditions and loud machinery, and require appropriate personal protective equipment.

Maintenance of member and provider data within Evolent’s Utilization Management and Claims Platforms

  Summary:
Yorktown Systems Group is seeking a qualified Data Analyst Junior to support the Veterans Health Administration (VHA) of the Department of Veteran Affairs (VA) with its Integrated External Networks (IEN) services. The IEN services is responsible for day-to-day supervision of managing Veteran, provider and customer relations experience, community care contracts, medical claims payment/reimbursement, network support and adequacy, and other activities associated with the design, development, and maintenance of a high performing network of providers providing VA care to Veterans and family members in the community.

IEN provides appropriate advice, assistance, and executive oversight to existing third party administrators (TPAs) and stakeholders utilizing the community network of providers including, but not limited to, VHA program offices, Veteran Integrated Service Networks (VISNs), Veteran Affairs Medical Centers (VAMCs) and other federal agencies. This includes guidance on development and/or modification of business practices as necessary to ensure sound management practices, contract management, performance oversight, and appropriate operations services that will maximize and improve the quality, timeliness, and satisfaction of VHA’s external network of healthcare providers that render services to our nations Veterans, and well as Veterans and their family members.

Job Title: Finance Business Intelligence Analyst - Entry Level Opportunities
Description:
Job detailsHere’s how the job details align with your profile.Job typeFull-time Full job description
When you join Verizon
You want more out of a career. A place to share your ideas freely — even if they’re daring or different. Where the true you can learn, grow, and thrive. At Verizon, we power and empower how people live, work and play by connecting them to what brings them joy. We do what we love — driving innovation, creativity, and impact in the world. Our V Team is a community of people who anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together — lifting our communities and building trust in how we show up, everywhere & always. Want in? Join the V Team Life.

 What you’ll be doing...

From internships and co-ops to leadership development programs and entry-level roles, Verizon’s award-winning Campus program allows you to take the next step toward shaping your future. Our Campus program has been recognized with awards like WayUp’s Top 100 Internship Programs and RippleMatch’s Campus Forward Award. Why the accolades? It’s easy. We quickly immerse you in meaningful work and projects that deliver tangible business impact. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to network with V Teamers across the globe, find mentors, and establish meaningful friendships that could last a lifetime. Start here and go anywhere, with opportunities across the business. When students like you join the V Team, our network becomes even stronger.

As part of a dynamic and challenging Finance organization, you will help some of the world’s biggest enterprises do business smarter. Joining a team that collaborates and provides solutions – you'll be doing more than just working the numbers. You will be given responsibilities for key components for the entire credit granting process, including the consistent application of a credit policy, periodic credit reviews of existing customers, and the assessment of the creditworthiness of potential customers, with the goal of optimizing the mix of company sales and bad debt losses.

In this role, you may have the opportunity to:

Create, analyze and interpret reports for managers providing recommendations to guide business decisions.
Ensures compliance with internal policies and controls, and with external regulations.
Identify improvement opportunities for your work stream and work closely with either the internal team or service providers to enable the implementation of improvement opportunities.
Assist in assessing the services delivered by the service providers and validating that performance metrics established by service level agreements are met as applicable.
Manage, evaluate and maintain credit policies for consumer credit worthiness.
Evaluate and monitor scoring models to ensure that they are empirically derived, statistically sound including credit scorecard validation and redevelopment.
Perform Consumer and Business Credit Screening Strategy Development, Deployment, and Analysis.
Perform Business Intelligence and Data Analysis, Descriptive Statistics and Performance Validation of existing and potential Credit Strategies.
Support empirically derived predictive model development and life cycle.
Ad-hoc reporting, tracking and trending, and predictive measures using commonly used statistical measures.


You must be currently enrolled in a degree program and be in good academic standing to be considered.

If you are interested in other roles and locations in addition to this one, please submit your application to those postings as well in order to be considered.

 What we’re looking for...

You’re a motivated self-starter. Never satisfied with the status quo, you’re always trying to beat a personal best. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where new challenges come up every day. You are flexible, dependable and work well in varying environments. Learning quickly is personally rewarding and inspires you to take smart risks.

You’ll need to have:

Current enrollment in a Bachelor’s degree program in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Economics, Business IT, Statistics, Math or related major at an accredited college or university with an expected completion date between December 2024 and June 2025.
Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship.
Willingness to work in Basking Ridge, NJ.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially in Excel.
Experience or knowledge of the following: data querying and analytics, record reconciliation, SQL.
Creating queries and reporting tools.
Experience working with financial, accounting and credit support systems.
Strong written and oral communications skills.
Ability to analyze data and interpret credit performance metrics.
Knowledge of statistical credit modeling methodologies.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.








 Where you’ll be working






 In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.
 
 Scheduled Weekly Hours 40
 
 Equal Employment Opportunity
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

Job Description

 About Altera:

Altera empowers customers to unlock the full potential of data through cutting-edge programmable platforms. In Q4 2023, Intel announced Altera will be reported as a separate business unit beginning on January 1, 2024 with ongoing support from Intel. This will give Altera the autonomy and flexibility it needs to fully accelerate its growth and more effectively compete in the FPGA industry, which serves a broad array of markets, including the data center, communications, industrial, automotive, aerospace and defense sectors.
This position is associated to that standalone business strategy and is expected to fully transition to a standalone company at some time in the future.  About the Role:

This is a great opportunity to get exposure to a startup and help standing up Altera.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Analyst to join our Altera Talent team. In this role, you will be responsible for bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions, ensuring that our projects align with the strategic goals of the organization.
 Responsibilities include but not limited to:

Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders to identify business needs and document requirements clearly and accurately.
Data Analysis: Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement.
Process Improvement: Document business processes and recommend solutions to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Project Support: Assist in project planning, execution, and monitoring, ensuring that deliverables meet quality standards and are completed on time.
Documentation: Create and maintain documentation related to business requirements, functional specifications, and project progress.
Testing Support: Develop and execute test plans to validate that solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users as needed, ensuring smooth implementation of new processes and systems.

 Qualifications

 You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.

 Minimum Qualifications

Division Information
 The Home & Garden business unit of Spectrum Brands is based in St. Louis, Missouri with distribution, manufacturing and sales offices throughout the US and globe. We are a leading supplier of consumer products nationally for the home, lawn and garden, insect and weed control markets. We deliver groundbreaking products of exceptional value and top-notch quality to consumers with our well-recognized brands including Spectracide®, Hot Shot®, Cutter®, Repel®, Black Flag®, Garden Safe®, EcoLogic® and Liquid Fence®. Job Summary
 Gathers and analyzes data to develop insights used for the optimization of the organization's supply chain operations. Identifies underperforming areas in the supply chain by analyzing costs, capacity, and demand patterns. Continuously reviews the movement of materials and other supply chain processes to identify sources of problems and to develop suggestions for solutions. Prepares reports or dashboards to provide reliable activity data to stakeholders. Monitors suppliers for contract compliance. May assist in the negotiation of contracts or service arrangements Primary Duties & Responsibilities

Measure and monitor Spectrum Brands Supply Chain performance to provide near real time indication of key customer metrics.
Investigate and resolve customer fines. Identify opportunities to reduce customer fines.
Publish Customer calculated metrics to Spectrum Brands.
Identify opportunities and projects to close any gap between actual and expected performance.
Identify and drive Supply Chain projects that reduce total Supply Chain cost to the customer.
On a daily basis, work with the Customer Service team to drive decisions that meet customer service level targets.
Access customer data systems to provide market information to Spectrum Brands.
Assist and manage supply chain activities for a particular customer base as assigned by the Director of Supply Chain.
 Education and Experience Profile

Bachelor’s degree in business or related field or equivalent experience
2-4 years of progressively responsible experience in the field of supply chain logistics, forecasting and/or sales analysis.
Experience required in Excel, Windows, Access, Word, Co-Managed system, SAP.
 Required Skills

Must be able to work effectively with other functions including, but not limited to Inventory Planning, Demand Planning, Customer Service, Distribution, Transportation, Marketing and the Sales organization.
Ability to query systems to identify sources of required data for metric purposes.

  About This Job
  Are you a problem solver? Do you enjoy mastering puzzles, especially those involving numbers? Does math get you excited? Do you spend more time on GitHub than social media?  If so, the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) business unit wants you as a Data Analyst. You will apply your strong technical and analytical skills to developing best in class risk monitoring and governance tools.  To excel in this role, you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, a deep understanding of essential data analysis tools and databases, and a practical understanding of how these tools can produce optimal results.
 

  Responsibilities:
 



    Work to clearly define scalable business requirements with GRC teams (Bank Secrecy Act, Compliance, and Enterprise Risk Management) to design and implement reporting and analytics for monitoring, audit, and data collection requests.
   


    Analyze and leverage high-volume data to identify relationships, trends, and exceptions.
   


    Troubleshoot data quality and technology issues, debug code and optimize queries.
   


    Perform risk and regulatory related special projects and assignments, as directed.
   


    Identify and execute enhancement and automation opportunities for business unit processes.
   



  Required:
 



    Bachelor's degree
   


    3+ years' of Python and/or R experience or demonstrably equivalent skill (specifically custom automation, integration with SQL, data analysis and/or AI/ML libraries).
   


    1+ year of data visualization (Tableau or Power BI) experience or demonstrably equivalent skill (specifically building dashboards and high impact visualizations).
   


    1+ year of SQL experience or demonstrably equivalent skill (specifically developing and optimizing queries, customizing to specific requirements, and analyzing data).
   


  Preferred:
 



    Financial services background with understanding of core banking and securities clearing products and familiarity with compliance practices.
   


    Workflow development tools in an Agile environment (ServiceNow, Azure and/or Jira).
   


    Familiarity with systems development processes such as UAT testing and data validation.
   


    Familiarity with data warehouse concepts and Oracle database best practices.
   


    Familiarity with advanced modelling concepts and validation.

Requires well-developed human relations skills to explain detailed information to small groups and work with staff in advisory capacity.

 Overview: 
 
  Our team members are the heart of what makes us better.

 The Clinical Data Analyst is responsible for providing support of the collection, organization and integrity of clinical data required for clinical quality measure reporting and/or clinical service registry reporting. This position works closely and serves as the link between clinical quality measures and public reporting objectives and the core technological capabilities the Digital Technology Services (DTS) Team is building across the Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH) network. Responsible for assisting DTS on tool development required for clinical quality measure monitoring and reporting internal and external to HMH.
  Responsibilities: 
 
  A day in the life of a Clinical Data Analyst at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:
 

Provides measure expertise and business insights to DTS for data analytics tool development and reporting to ensure measurement methodologies and data dictionaries are reflected accurately.
Responsible for the maintenance of the clinical catalog that provides measure details; rules, criteria, definitions, validation, ways that analytics tools can reference/lookup measures (regulatory measures as well as internal measures).
Maintains clinical quality measurement knowledge through self-development and keeps current on all specification changes relevant to assigned project(s).
Collaborate with DTS ensuring Epic data collection and outside data abstraction efforts align in the data warehouse.
Support DTS by providing quality assurance for analytics tools utilizing quality measures.
Ensures the integrity and accuracy of information extracted or collected and entered into the data collection system.
Assesses potential problems affecting the data collection process and coordinates follow-up of problem resolution with the team and/or manager.
Learns and understands the varied databases and project related terminology. Participates on all educational sessions and/or webinars.
Performs data submissions to CMS and TJC.
Facilitates and collaborates with DTS for data uploads specific to regulatory submission data.
Responsible for access requests to Epic and/or third-party applications for vendor abstractors.
Keep continuous up to date knowledge of regulatory measures such as core measure, eCQM and claim measures as directed by leadership.
Processes access requests to Epic and/or third-party applications for vendor abstractors.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
 Qualifications: 
 
 Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
 

Minimum of 2 years of experience in healthcare.
Bachelor's degree in healthcare field or professional degree.
Proficient skills in analytical methodologies, understanding of databases, and/or spreadsheet, technical writing, quantitative analysis and/or use of statistical principles.
Proficiency in the use of computer applications and software for communication (e-mail, scheduling, and remote conferencing), word processing, spreadsheet function, and presentation preparation.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to present to various levels within the organization.
Comprehensive knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology.
Experience or knowledge of ICD-10 coding.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with demonstrated ability to work well with all levels of staff.
Strong critical thinking skills with ability to handle changing work environments and prioritize activities based on department needs.
Detail-oriented and meets quality and productivity standards.
Ability and willingness to be cross-trained and become proficient in multiple clinical domains.
Proficient computer skills that may include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite platforms.





Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
 

Experience working with Epic.
Understanding of national quality performance measurement and reporting, particularly those identified by the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), the State of New Jersey Department of Health, and the Joint Commission.
Proficiency in Google applications.





Licenses and Certifications Preferred:
 

National Patient Safety Foundation (NPSF) Certified Professional in Patient Safety (CPPS) certification within three years of hire.

Join the Cleveland Clinic team, where you will work alongside passionate caregivers and provide patient-first healthcare. Cleveland Clinic is recognized as one of the top hospitals in the nation. At Cleveland Clinic, you will work alongside dedicated caregivers, receive endless support and appreciation, and build a rewarding career with one of the most respected healthcare organizations in the world.  The Market Intelligence Analyst, will assists in the commercialization of a large portfolio of inventions by supporting market intelligence activities focused on assessing the viability of new medical technologies as part of a cross functional team. The primary focus of this position will be on biopharma therapeutics and diagnostic technologies.

The ideal caregiver is someone who:

Has three years of experience in one or more of the following areas: healthcare market research, financial analysis, business modeling, or technology commercialization. OR Advanced degree may offset up to 2 years' experience.
Demonstrates understanding of medical technology and healthcare industry market trends and regulations.
Is comfortable working with large data sets (e.g. Excel).


 This is a rewarding opportunity that offers growth-oriented projects, mentorship, support, and resources. You will experience great exposure to both the institute and department leadership and have numerous opportunities for career growth.



 At Cleveland Clinic, we know what matters most. That's why we treat our caregivers as if they are our own family, and we are always creating ways to be there for you. Here, you'll find that we offer: resources to learn and grow, a fulfilling career for everyone, and comprehensive benefits that invest in your health, your physical and mental well-being and your future. When you join Cleveland Clinic, you'll be part of a supportive caregiver family that will be united in shared values and purpose to fulfill our promise of being the best place to receive care and the best place to work in healthcare.  Responsibilities:


Assists in the commercialization of a large portfolio of inventions by supporting market intelligence activities focused on assessing the viability of new medical technologies.
Conducts market research studies to provide timely and accurate information in the assessment of business opportunities across a large portfolio of intellectual property.
Collects, compiles and analyzes data from primary and secondary sources to construct procedure and product sales models, target market profiles, demographic and epidemiological models, competitive technology profiles, pricing and reimbursement analyses, and investment benchmark analyses.
Conducts prior art searches and patentability assessments.
Prepares reports, presentations and informational briefs to communicate market research findings and recommendations to internal and external clients.
Participates in strategic planning efforts and supports operational decision marking for portfolio technologies and companies.
Other duties as assigned.


 Education: 

Bachelor's degree in Business, Biomedical Engineering, Physical or Life Science, or related field required; advanced degree preferred.


 Certifications: 

None required.


 Complexity of Work: 

Requires critical thinking skills, decisive judgment, and the ability to work under limited supervision.
Necessitates understanding of specific needs and requirements to apply subject matter expertise.
Must be able to work in a stressful environment and take appropriate action.


 Physical Requirements: 

Requires frequent sitting, normal or corrected vision and manual dexterity sufficient to perform work on a personal computer.
Requires the ability to walk to various locations to attend meetings.


 Personal Protective Equipment:

Follows standard precautions using personal protective equipment as required.

Aquafix, Inc. is a biological sciences company based in Madison, Wisconsin providing products to help wastewater treatment plant operators succeed at their job.
Responsibilities:
Our Marketing Analyst will need to be someone who strives for credible results by maintaining a focus on the specificity, exactness, and finiteness of their projects. We are looking for an individual with a passion for research and analyzing data that can be presented in an intelligible format.   There is a place for you at T. Rowe Price to grow, contribute, learn, and make a difference. We are a premier asset manager focused on delivering global investment management excellence and retirement services that investors can rely on today and in the future. The work we do matters. We invite you to explore the opportunity to join us and grow your career with us.
 


  About This Position
 

  The Sales Intelligence & Insights team seeks a creative problem-solver passionate about crafting insightful visualizations. We value independent decision-making and limitless curiosity. Our team culture strikes a balance between autonomy and collaboration, enabling us to provide rapid, unscheduled production support while also advancing larger, more complex projects. As part of an industry-leading revenue enablement group, our team equips sellers with the compelling insights they need to excel in their roles through high-impact, intelligent actions.
 


  On a day-to-day basis, the Senior Analyst, Data Analytics will join disparate data sources, perform analysis, build and maintain dashboards that visualize complex data to deliver valuable insights that drive business decisions. In this role you will also perform data reviews, report updates, basic quantitative analysis, quality assurance, and project document editing. Much of your work will be done by manipulating data sets in Alteryx and Excel, conducting exploratory analysis in Salesforce or external data portals, and delivering results through user-friendly Tableau dashboards. A great fit for this role can communicate and collaborate across many different teams, has a knack for troubleshooting, and familiarity with data structure, relational and non-relational databases, and data optimization techniques.
 

  Prior experience in the financial sector is beneficial but not required: we will teach you the key concepts of asset management and sales enablement.
 


  Role Summary
 

  Conducts moderately complex analyses and evaluates data and reporting to deliver functional analytics or business insights. Develops advanced data visualizations to assist business stakeholders.
 


  Responsibilities:
 



    Independently supports assigned area with advanced, complex statistical and quantitative analyses. In partnership with business subject matter experts, leads development of statistical modeling and quantitative analysis projects. Serves as a resource to less experienced team members in development of methodologies and techniques.
   


    Validates and reviews results to ensure they address identified business needs.
   


    Prepares visualizations and delivers results to management and/or other leaders. In partnership with business subject matter experts, provides recommendations for addressing observed outcomes. Translates complex technical concepts and analyses to nontechnical audiences.
   


    Leads cross-functional groups to define requirements. Oversees internal and external business partners in the execution of the plan. Stays abreast of changes in the market to identify opportunities for improved analytical capabilities and methods. Drafts project plans, use cases, user stories, or business cases.
   



  Qualifications:
 

  Required:
 



    Bachelor's degree or the equivalent combination of education and relevant experience AND
   


    5+ years of total relevant work experience
   



  FINRA Requirements
 

  FINRA licenses are not required and will not be supported for this role.
 


  Work Flexibility
 

  This role is eligible for hybrid work, with up to two days per week from home.
 


  Base salary ranges:
  $114,500.00 - $195,000.00 for the location of: California, New York $100,500.00 - $171,500.00 for the location of: Washington, D.C $91,500.00 - $156,500.00 for the location of: Colorado, Maryland, Washington and All other US locations
 

  Placement within the range provided above is based on the individual’s relevant experience and skills for the role. Base salary is only one component of our total compensation package. Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus, which is determined upon company and individual performance.
 


  This job posting is expected to be available until:
  11/30/2024

When we embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work, our firm is stronger, and we create greater value for our clients. Our commitment and inclusive programming aim to lift the experience for each associate and builds allies for our global associate community. We know that a sense of belonging is key not only to your success at the firm, but also to your ability to bring your best each day.

Analyst shall manage the day-to-day activities involving the establishment, management, and oversight of electricity accounts for the company. The responsibilities of this position shall include developing and maintaining contacts with utilities for setting-up, reviewing and disconnecting utility services with a focus on electricity. Incumbent must be knowledgeable of ERCOT connection data protocols. This position shall oversee and coordinate all third-party support services and organizations used to supply detailed and specialty utility services to the company. On an as-needed basis the incumbent shall provide electricity usage and cost analysis to management and trouble-shoot specific account errors. This position will support invoice payment activities including preparation, verification, and submission for payment. The Analyst will report to the office (full- time) 5 days a week.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Manage and coordinate utility service connections with utility companies, including IOUs, cooperatives, and municipalities.
Develop, modify, and maintain company data request forms.
Ensure compliance and accuracy of account data necessary for the establishment of new service locations, review data forms for accuracy and completeness.
Engage utilities for proper account set-up. Confirm required field activities and set-up schedules.
Prepare payment documents for project required CIAC payments.
Manage CIAC payment process including securing proper approvals and account coding.
Create and manage company utility database Site Numbers for all utility services including electric, water, gas, and waste services.
Acquire ESI ID numbers for new meters in the deregulated electricity areas.
Submit all move-ins, switches, and move-outs to third-party service provider for all electricity meters in deregulated electricity service territories.
Migrate new assets into ETP business structure.
Maintain contact utility companies regarding outages or construction repairs to existing service and communication with appropriate operations personnel.
Prepare cost and usage reports monthly for budgeting for management.
Utilize software platform to prepare utility invoices for review and payment and secure requisite approvals as needed.
Acquire 911 addresses for new meters as needed.
Prepare monthly invoices for payment for third-party services.
Download invoice, GL file, Consolidation Detail & Invoice Detail for each ETP client set up with third-party bill processor.
Validate consolidation entries for data and account accuracy.
Obtain approvals and execute consolidated bill payments.
Download billing detail report from third-party portal website and prepare documents for proper backup documentation.
Prepare, secure requisite approvals, and pay monthly multiple ERCOT and TDSP invoices.
Coordinate information flow with Treasury and Accounting.
Daily Day Ahead Invoices (DAM)- for CRRAH and QSE.
Daily Download of DAM Settlement Statements for CRRAH and QSE as back up for DAM Invoices.
Daily download of RTM Initial, Final, True-up and possible re-settlement Statements as back up for RTM invoices.
Interface with operations and engineering on each utility account set up after each acquisition.
Verify all address, meter, utility, and account information for accuracy.
Confirm account information upload into third-party systems.
Establish Site Number creation logic scheme for all utility services.
Preparation and provide employee training on utility systems and set-up protocols and procedures.
Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Experience in the utility industry in account set-ups, billing error corrections, and disconnection preferred.
Working with ERCOT either directly or through a specialized third-party regarding account establishment and management.
Working knowledge of cooperatives, municipalities, regulated and unregulated electric utilities and the unique attributes and constraints of each.
Knowledge of accounting and treasury functions and information requirements.
Develop data templates in spreadsheets and databases.
Strong Communication Skills – Written and Verbal required as need to communicate both internally and externally with ROW Agents, Project Managers, Utility Representatives, etc.
Ability to work with a team in a high-paced environment.
Ability to prioritize one’s workload and being able to work cross-functionally.
Oil and Gas experience and/or contract management experience are preferred.

Excel
Word

ENGIE

  Your Future Evolves Here
 



   Evolent partners with health plans and providers to achieve better outcomes for people with most complex and costly health conditions. Working across specialties and primary care, we seek to connect the pieces of fragmented health care system and ensure people get the same level of care and compassion we would want for our loved ones.
  


   Evolent employees enjoy work/life balance, the flexibility to suit their work to their lives, and autonomy they need to get things done. We believe that people do their best work when they're supported to live their best lives, and when they feel welcome to bring their whole selves to work. That's one reason why diversity and inclusion are core to our business.
  


   Join Evolent for the mission. Stay for the culture.
  


   What You’ll Be Doing:
  



  Put your passion where it meets purpose! Evolent attracts some of the brightest minds in health care. Surround yourself with talented, driven colleagues who share a passion for better health outcomes and a more connected care journey. We are hiring for an Operations Support Analyst to join our Data Management Team.
 


  The Operations Support Analyst is a dynamic role that will encompass overall support and maintenance of member and provider data. This position reports to the Supervisor, Data Management.
 


  Collaboration Opportunities:
 


  The Operations Support Analyst will collaborate with many teams across the organization to help resolve requests related to member and provider data.
 


  What You Will Be Doing:
 

Maintenance of member and provider data within Evolent’s Utilization Management and Claims Platforms
Responsible for managing concurrent projects as assigned
Establishing and maintaining excellent relationships, internally and externally
Working on special projects
Communication to management
Maintain contractual service level and/or operational level agreements, as applicable
Moderate to complex data analysis using Excel and SQL
Cross-domain collaboration for escalated issues and/or process improvement
Oversight of daily inventories in JIRA Dashboard
Perform quality audits to ensure data accuracy and completeness
Update member and provider data with accuracy and complete quality review in a timely manner
Ability to work in an agile space and adapt to fluctuating situations
Takes initiative and works independently
Ability to time manage and reprioritize tasks/projects as appropriate



  Qualifications – Required and Preferred:
 

BA preferred or equivalent work experience (Required)
Minimum of two years’ experience in healthcare field related to member and provider enrollment, provider services and/or configuration (Required)
General understanding of US health care, Managed Care Organizations, and/or third-party administrator (Required)
Intermediate to advanced PC skills in the following Microsoft Office based environments (Excel, Word, Teams, OneNote, Outlook) (Required)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (Required)
Detail oriented with good organizational skills (Required)
SQL Server Experience (Preferred)


  Technical Requirements:

Role description

Technical Data Analyst
 Lead I - Business Analysis

 Who We Are:
Born digital, UST transforms lives through the power of technology. We walk alongside our clients and partners, embedding innovation and agility into everything they do. We help them create transformative experiences and human-centered solutions for a better world.
UST is a mission-driven group of 29,000+ practical problem solvers and creative thinkers in more than 30 countries. Our entrepreneurial teams are empowered to innovate, act nimbly, and create a lasting and sustainable impact for our clients, their customers, and the communities in which we live.
With us, you’ll create a boundless impact that transforms your career—and the lives of people across the world.
Visit us at UST.com.

 You Are:
UST is looking for a Technical Data Analyst who has hands on experience migrating Sales users and Sales data like Accounts, Opportunities, Contacts from Salesforce.com to Dynamics 365. He should also have strong experience in data profiling, data integration, transformations, understanding how data impacts downstream systems like Sales and Finance data warehouses/data lakes, reporting etc.

 The opportunity:

Work with Customer internal data teams and business teams to decipher the data related requirements for the project.


Work with the Product Managers to build detailed data requirements/specifications for Engineering teams to build the solution in downstream data management and reporting systems.


Design end to end strategy to stitch objects from various systems and financial KPIs


Building integrations between SFDC, Dynamics, SAP ECC and DBX for Power BI reporting and financial metrics.


Leverage data sources across the enterprise to build sophisticated and insightful analyses and data models for Sales, Finance and Marketing


Consolidate requirements and suggest building new reporting capabilities for analysis using advanced BI techniques and tools.


Proactively collaborate with various product managers to bring a perspective on all data we work on.


Conducts QA testing and validations and provides inputs to the Engineering teams – along with the PdMs


Support Release Planning, scheduling backlog items into regular releases aligned to business priority while working with the PdM’s


Supports production cutover and Production acceptance testing.


Supports post go live sessions with business, addresses and drives technical issues raised during Hyper Care. This will be done with the PdM’s and Engineering teams.


This position description identifies the responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the performance of the position. Other relevant essential functions may be required.

 What you need:

Need to have hands on experience with migrating Marketing and Sales data and users from Salesforce.com to Dynamics


Need to understand the migration challenges from similar experiences and build creative solutions to help with migrating data from SFDC to Dynamics.


Requires bachelor’s degree. Preferred candidates will have a major in computer science, MBA from reputable institution or equivalent experience.


4+ years of data analytics, ‘data BSA’ or data product management experience with solid understanding of how to deliver data solutions in an agile environment.


Strong proficiency in SQL/SparkSQL/Python to query and manipulate large data sets. Experience with platforms like Databricks, Power BI and Tableau.


You are a self-starter, independent, hard worker, with a high degree of motivation to go above and beyond the task at hand. You anticipate and creatively implement next steps in a complex environment.


You have mastered the ability to influence outcomes, navigate, mediate to consensus with integrity. You possess great interpersonal communication, presentation skills, and social skills and a solid sense of humor.


Data requirement writing skills: collecting, prioritizing, and gathering input from multiple sources, providing accurate requirements with attention to detail.


You already know or can rapidly learn enterprise application capabilities in order to deliver transaction and event-driven data solutions (examples: SAP/HANA, MS Dynamics or Salesforce Data, ADLS/Hadoop/Databricks datalake/lakehouse solutions, and/or Kafka streams)


Need to have hands on experience in understanding the SFDC to Dynamics field mappings & data models.


Compensation can differ depending on factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, education, and level of experience. UST provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in various U.S. markets as set forth below.
 Role Location: California
 Compensation Range: $70,000-$107,000

 Benefits
Full-time, regular employees accrue a minimum of 10 days of paid vacation per year, receive 6 days of paid sick leave each year (pro-rated for new hires throughout the year), 10 paid holidays, and are eligible for paid bereavement leave and jury duty. They are eligible to participate in the Company’s 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer matching. They and their dependents residing in the US are eligible for medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as the following Company-paid Employee Only benefits: basic life insurance, accidental death and disability insurance, and short- and long-term disability benefits. Regular employees may purchase additional voluntary short-term disability benefits, and participate in a Health Savings Account (HSA) as well as a Flexible Spending Account (FSA) for healthcare, dependent child care, and/or commuting expenses as allowable under IRS guidelines. Benefits offerings vary in Puerto Rico.
Part-time employees receive 6 days of paid sick leave each year (pro-rated for new hires throughout the year) and are eligible to participate in the Company’s 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer matching.
Full-time temporary employees receive 6 days of paid sick leave each year (pro-rated for new hires throughout the year) and are eligible to participate in the Company’s 401(k) program with employer matching. They and their dependents residing in the US are eligible for medical, dental, and vision insurance.
Part-time temporary employees receive 6 days of paid sick leave each year (pro-rated for new hires throughout the year).
All US employees who work in a state or locality with more generous paid sick leave benefits than specified here will receive the benefit of those sick leave laws.

 What we believe:
We proudly embrace the values that have shaped UST since day one. We build our culture of Humility, Humanity, and Integrity.
